to be notified of important product support alerts like this.\\\\n\\\\nIMPORTANT NOTE\\\\n IBM strongly suggests that all System z customers be subscribed to the System z Security Portal to receive the latest critical System z security and integrity service. If you are not subscribed, see the instructions on the System z Security web site [http://www.ibm.com/systems/z/solutions/security_subintegrity.html]. Security and integrity APARs and associated fixes will be posted to this portal. IBM suggests reviewing the CVSS scores and applying all security or integrity fixes as soon as possible to minimize any potential risk.\\\\n\\\\nREFERENCES\\\\nComplete CVSS v3 Guide [http://www.first.org/cvss/user-guide]\\\\nOn-line Calculator v3 [http://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/3.0]\\\\nIBM Java SDK Security Bulletin [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21986642]\\\\nRELATED INFORMATION\\\\nIBM Secure Engineering Web Portal [http://www.ibm.com/security/secure-engineering/bulletins.html]\\\\nIBM Product Security Incident Response Blog [http://www.ibm.com/blogs/psirt]\\\\n\\\\nCHANGE HISTORY\\\\n 30 Mar 2017 - Original version Published\\\\n\\\\n*The CVSS Environment Score is customer environment specific and will ultimately impact the Overall CVSS Score. Customers can evaluate the impact of this vulnerability in their environments by accessing the links in the Reference section of this Security Bulletin.\\\\n\\\\nDISCLAIMER\\\\nAccording to the Forum of Incident Response and Security Teams (FIRST), the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) is an \\\\\\"industry open standard designed to convey vulnerability severity and help to determine urgency and priority of response.\\\\\\" IBM PROVIDES THE CVSS SCORES \\\\\\"AS IS\\\\\\" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. CUSTOMERS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR ASSESSING THE IMPACT OF ANY ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL SECURITY VULNERABILITY.\\\\n\\\\nRELATED INFORMATION\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -1.6099,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"08ceb9a6\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"08ceb9a6-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"fix pack update bug correction APAR TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"fix pack update bug correction APAR TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n When and how should I apply a modification or fix pack to my JRules or Operational Decision Management (WODM/ODM) installation?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nThe Operational Decision Manager version numbers use the standard IBM formatV.R.M.Fwhich stands for Version.Release.Modification.Fixpack. See the V.R.M.F Maintenance Stream Delivery Vehicle terminology explanation [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27008656] for more details.\\\\n\\\\nModification and fix pack numbers are the third and fourth digits in the IBM product version number, for example: 8.5.M.F.\\\\n\\\\nModification and fix packs include only bug fixes, so they do not affect the product functionality or your data.\\\\n\\\\nSee the following technotes to find out which update your installation need:\\\\n\\\\n * Finding the version of ODM product and fixes [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21627850] to determine the exact product versions that are installed on your machine.\\\\n\\\\n * Find the version of ODM components [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21400738] to determine the exact module or library versions that are deployed on your servers.\\\\n\\\\n * Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] to learn about the latest modification or fix pack that is available for your product version.\\\\n\\\\n * IBM Operational Decision Manager detailed system requirements [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27023067] to verify that your configuration is supported with your current product version.\\\\n\\\\n * IBM Support Lifecycle [http://www.ibm.com/software/websphere/support/lifecycle/] to verify that your current version does not reach end of support in the near future.\\\\n\\\\nReferring to the last two documents above, you may find out that you need to migrate to the latest product version to ensure continued support of your applications. In that case, refer to technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725].\\\\n\\\\nThat being said, make sure to consider migrating to the latest version or release ( V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from the latest added features and improvements.\\\\nANSWER\\\\nAs with any software product, even if you do not have any issues with running your current configuration, you should apply the latest modification or fix pack to take advantage of these benefits:\\\\n\\\\n * Anticipate and avoid the risk of encountering defects already fixed.\\\\n * Apply the latest product improvements that are available (performance, for example).\\\\n * Maintain a serviceable system and be able to install an interim fix when required.\\\\n\\\\nWHEN TO UPDATE\\\\nThe latest modification or fix pack should be installed as soon as it is available.\\\\n\\\\nYou can subscribe to the IBM Support My Notifications [https://www.ibm.com/support/mynotifications] to be notified of any fix pack releases, and you can also bookmark the Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] page, which lists the latest modifications or fix packs.\\\\n\\\\nSee the technote Fix pack release notification for Operational Decision Manager [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665593] to find out when a modification or fix pack will be available.\\\\n\\\\nBEFORE UPDATING\\\\n\\\\nThe databases used in the sample server are deleted and recreated during the update. If you are using those databases and want to save the existing content, perform the following steps before updating:\\\\n *  Stop the sample server. In the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby, create an archive file containing the resdb and rtsdb folders. Save the archive file, such as zip file, in the data folder. After installation, unzip the archive file in the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby to restore your databases before restarting the sample server.\\\\n\\\\nA new profile is also created for the sample server, at the first server start following the installation of a modification or fix pack.\\\\n\\\\nIf you want to continue using the same ports, you must delete the existing profile prior. In the <ODM_HOME>/shared/bin folder, from the command line, run the command ../tools/ant/bin/ant forcedestroyprofile.\\\\n\\\\nNote: The sample server is not designed to be used in a production system. For a production system, you must create a dedicated profile and database that you update using the following steps.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATING\\\\n\\\\nEach modification or fix pack page provides instructions on how to download and run the installer, in addition to providing a list of corrections that are included in the update.\\\\n\\\\nThe fix pack installation updates the following files and folders:  * JAR libraries in the installation directories, including <ODMInstallDir>\\\\\\\\<Module>\\\\\\\\lib.\\\\n * EAR and WAR applications in the <ODMInstallDir>\\\\\\\\<Module>\\\\\\\\applicationservers\\\\\\\\<App Server> folders.\\\\n\\\\nOnce this is done, you perform these tasks:  * Repackage your client applications with the up-to-date libraries.\\\\n * Reapply product customizations to the up-to-date Java EE modules (EARs and WARs).\\\\n\\\\nNote that all customizations you developed before the update, for example modifications of the descriptors, must be reapplied to the new, up-to-date EARs and WARs. It is a good idea to document and automate those customizations using scripts to make the process easier and error-proof.\\\\n\\\\nFinally, you must update the client applications and ODM modules on your server or servers with the same settings as you deployed previously. If you redeploy the application, follow again the documentation instructions to deploy all ODM modules to your servers [http://pic.dhe.ibm.com/infocenter/dmanager/v8r5m1/topic/com.ibm.odm.distrib.config/topics/odm_distrib_config.html].\\\\n\\\\nKeep in mind that applying a modification or a fix pack does not require any data migration, so your projects and database remain the same.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATING RULE EXECUTION SERVER\\\\n\\\\nUpdate the following applications in the application server:  *  jrules-res-xu-<server>.rar jrules-res-management-<server>.ear jrules-ssp-<server>.ear jrules-res-htds-<server>ear\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nNote: Updating the eXecution Unit RAR file requires a restart of the server.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATE DECISION CENTER\\\\n\\\\nUpdate the following application in your application server:\\\\n * jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nUPDATE THE EVENTS RUNTIME\\\\n\\\\n 1. Stop the event runtime application, wberuntimeear.\\\\n 2. Uninstall the following applications, if they exist:  * wbefileconnector\\\\n     * wbehttpconnector\\\\n     * wbejdbcconnector\\\\n     * wbejmsconnector\\\\n     * wbesoapconnector\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. Update the application wberuntimeear.\\\\n 4. Start the application wberuntimeear.\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nADDITIONAL CONSIDERATIONS\\\\n * Again, in addition to applying the latest modification or fix pack, consider migrating to the latest version or release (V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from recently added features and improvements. Delivery Vehicle [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27008656] (MDV) that produces incorrect or unexpected behavior causing a supported feature to stop functioning as designed.\\\\nThis includes:\\\\n\\\\n * Coding errors that cause a regression\\\\n * Documentation or packaging problems that cause a regression\\\\n * Errors reported in a new function delivered in a MDV that cause a regression\\\\n\\\\nIncomplete: An error in the MDV has not regressed, but does not work as designed.\\\\nThis includes:\\\\n\\\\n * Fixed APARs which did not solve the original problem but did not break anything new\\\\n * APARs reporting documentation errors, such as readme errors, that cause problems applying an MDV but do not lead to a regression\\\\n\\\\nNotes:  * Regression and incomplete APARs are considered fix-in-error or MDV-in-error\\\\n * Definitions above apply only to valid APARs that result in product fixes (APARs returned as working-as-designed are not assessed for being fix-in-error)\\\\n * Issues in major releases due to new functionality do not apply in this definition\\\\n\\\\nThere are no known regressions to report.\\\\n\\\\nBack to top\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEMS     76→ *  Change the process model and define the timer boundary event in
    77→   a different way. There are several options other than relative
    78→   to due date, for example, you could define the timer boundary
    79→   event relative to the start of the step or a custom date that is
    80→   hardcoded or is from a process variable.

    82→

    84→
    85→
    86→
    87→PROBLEM SUMMARY
    88→ *  If a user task runs in a loop, each task instance has its own
    89→   due date. A timer boundary event on an activity is a timer for
    90→   the overall activity, not a timer for each instance of the loop.
    91→   There is only one timer and that one timer cannot be calculated
    92→   relative to multiple different due dates of several task
    93→   instances. It is, therefore, not possible to run a process in
    94→   such a combination.

For maintenance purposes it may be necessary to install fix packs and/or interim fixes for eWAS and IHS.\\\\nYou can use this procedure to install fix packs and interim fixes for a given eWAS and IHS version, but not to upgrade to a new eWAS or IHS version. For example, you can use it to install eWAS 7.0.0.43 on top of eWAS 7.0.0.29, but you cannot use it to install eWAS version 8.0 on top of eWAS version 7.0.\\\\nThe following table shows the different levels of eWAS and IHS that are provided by 6.2.3:\\\\n\\\\nITM version eWAS version IHS version 6.23.05.00 7.0.0.29 7.0.0.00 6.23.03.00 - 6.23.04.00 7.0.0.25 7.0.0.00 6.23.01.00 - 6.23.02.00 7.0.0.19 7.0.0.00 6.23.00.00 7.0.0.15 7.0.0.00\\\\nThis technote applies specifically to eWAS, not the full version of WebSphere. Further, this technote applies only to V6.2.3 of ITM.\\\\nANSWER\\\\nFollow these steps to install a new eWAS fix pack into your ITM environment:\\\\n\\\\nStep 1. Back up your ITM environment.\\\\nBack up your ITM environment using your local procedures.\\\\n\\\\nStep 2. Download the maintenance installation scripts.\\\\nDownload the appropriate eWAS/IHS maintenance installation script to the system where your TEPS resides.\\\\nUnix/Linux: Download ewasihsv7update.sh attached below. Ensure that the script has execute permission after it has been downloaded.\\\\nls -l ./ewasihsv7update.sh\\\\nchmod a+rx ./ewasihsv7update.sh\\\\nWindows: Download ewasihsv7update.cmd attached below.\\\\n\\\\nStep 3. Generate the list of files that need to be downloaded.\\\\nRun ewasihsv7update.sh or ewasihsv7update.cmd to generate the list of files that need to be downloaded and to create the temporary directory to hold them.\\\\nWhen the prompt beginning with \\\\\\"Have all required files been downloaded to\\\\\\" is displayed,\\\\nrespond with n to exit the script so that you can download the required files.\\\\n\\\\nThe usage information for the command follows:\\\\n\\\\n * Unix:\\\\n   ewasihsv7update.sh [-h candle_directory] [-w working_directory] [-u updateinstaller directory]\\\\n   -h Fully qualified path of the ITM installation directory.\\\\n   -w Fully qualified path of the temporary working directory for file downloads.\\\\n   -u Fully qualified path of the UpdateInstaller installation directory.\\\\n   If ewasihsv7update.sh was downloaded to CANDLEHOME/bin/, then the -h option is not needed.\\\\n   The working directory default value is: /tmp/ewasihsv7. You can specify a different location using the -w option.\\\\n   The -u option should only be used when installation of the UpdateInstaller to the documented default directory is not permitted.  *  AIX Default Location:\\\\n      /usr/IBM/WebSphere/UpdateInstaller Linux Default Location:\\\\n      /opt/IBM/WebSphere/UpdateInstaller\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * Windows:\\\\n   ewasihsv7update.cmd [-h candle_directory] [-w working_directory] [-u updateinstaller directory]\\\\n   -h Fully qualified path of the ITM installation directory.\\\\n   -w Fully qualified path of the temporary working directory for file downloads.\\\\n   -u Fully qualified path of the UpdateInstaller installation directory.\\\\n   The ITM installation directory default value is the %CANDLE_HOME% value retrieved from the shell environment. Normally the -h option is not needed.\\\\n   The working directory default value is: %TEMP%\\\\\\\\ewasihsv7. You can specify a different location using the -w option.\\\\n   The -u option should only be used when installation of the UpdateInstaller to the documented default directory is not permitted.  * Windows Default Location:\\\\n      \\\\\\"C:\\\\\\\\Program Files\\\\\\\\IBM\\\\\\\\WebSphere\\\\\\\\UpdateInstaller\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nStep 4: Download the files listed in the output from step 3 between the two delimiter lines starting with:\\\\n<><><><><><><><><><>\\\\nThere are a number of ways to download the files:  1. If a browser is available on the TEPS system:  * For each file listed between the two delimiter lines in the output from step 3;  * Copy and paste the full line, one at a time, into the browser address bar and then hit enter.\\\\n        * Save the file to the working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 2. If the wget utility is available, in a command prompt on the TEPS system:  * Change directory to the working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n     * For each file listed between the two delimiter lines in the output from step 3;  * Enter the wget command followed by the copy and paste of the full line, and then hit enter.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. If the ftp utility is available, in a command prompt on the TEPS system:  * Change directory to the working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n     * Run the ftp command and connect to public.dhe.ibm.com as anonymous.\\\\n     * For each file listed between the two delimiter lines in the output from step 3;  * Change the remote directory to parent directory of the file (starting with /software/websphere/appserv/support)\\\\n        * Get the file.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 4. Use any other method available to you to download the files.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nStep 5. Install the UpdateInstaller and eWAS and IHS maintenance\\\\nRun ewasihsv7update.sh or ewasihsv7update.cmd again\\\\nWhen the prompt starting with \\\\\\"Have all required files been downloaded to\\\\\\" is displayed,\\\\nrespond with y to allow the script to continue and perform the UpdateInstaller and maintenance installation actions.\\\\n\\\\nStep 6. Cleanup\\\\nRemove the temporary working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n\\\\nStep 7. 71INS-APPSUP; 71ISM-PLAN; 71ISM-INS; 71ISM-CONF TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n What are the steps needed or recommendations available, in order to upgrade an ISM agent from v7.3 to v7.4, while SDA is already configured ?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nnot enough details in docs\\\\n\\\\nANSWER\\\\nA) use/check configuration of the SDA (Self-Describing Agents) mechanism on the TEMS/TEPS, so the ISM new application support is deployed automatically on TEMS, TEPS.\\\\nYou can refer to :\\\\n\\\\nISM agent and SDA\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS5MD2_7.4.0.1/com.ibm.itcamt.doc/common/sda.html?cp=SS5MD2_7.4.0.1%2F6-1-4-0&lang=en [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS5MD2_7.4.0.1/com.ibm.itcamt.doc/common/sda.html?cp=SS5MD2_7.4.0.1%2F6-1-4-0&lang=en]\\\\n\\\\nITM 6.3 self-describing monitoring agents\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSTFXA_6.3.0/com.ibm.itm.doc_6.3/adminuse/agentadmin_sda_intro.htm?lang=en [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSTFXA_6.3.0/com.ibm.itm.doc_6.3/adminuse/agentadmin_sda_intro.htm?lang=en]\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nB) if you are planning to install new fresh ISM 7.4 agent as well as upgrading old ISM 7.3 agent, install new ISM 7.4 fresh agent first.\\\\n\\\\nYou can refer to :\\\\n\\\\nISM 7.4 agent installation\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS5MD2_7.4.0.1/com.ibm.itcamt.doc/ism/dita/ag/topic/ISM_install_chapter.html?lang=en [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS5MD2_7.4.0.1/com.ibm.itcamt.doc/ism/dita/ag/topic/ISM_install_chapter.html?lang=en]\\\\n\\\\nC) upgrade your existing ISM 7.3 agent to v7.4\\\\nyou can refer to :\\\\n\\\\nISM agent upgrade\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS5MD2_7.4.0.1/com.ibm.itcamt.doc/ism/dita/ag/task/ISM_in_upgrade.html?lang=en [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS5MD2_7.4.0.1/com.ibm.itcamt.doc/ism/dita/ag/task/ISM_in_upgrade.html?lang=en]\\\\n\\\\nRemarks :\\\\n\\\\n- if you are planning to use recent OS version for your new ISM agent, like for example Windows 2012 R2, you need to install and use ISM 7.4.0.1 (not ISM 7.4.0.0);\\\\n\\\\nsee prerequisites web site report for ISM :\\\\nhttp://www-969.ibm.com/software/reports/compatibility/clarity-reports/report/html/softwareReqsForProductByComponent?deliverableId=1364203661236&duComponent=Miscellaneous_3F551130952E11E290021D5C0925FE1B [http://www-969.ibm.com/software/reports/compatibility/clarity-reports/report/html/softwareReqsForProductByComponent?deliverableId=1364203661236&duComponent=Miscellaneous_3F551130952E11E290021D5C0925FE1B]\\\\n\\\\n- Don\'t forget to install ISM 7401 application support on all your TEP client systems as well. Application support is not automatically applied to the Tivoli Enterprise Portal clients.\\\\nyou can refer to :\\\\n\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS5MD2_7.4.0.1/com.ibm.itcamt.doc/ism/dita/ag/topic/ISM_install_elements.html?lang=en [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS5MD2_7.4.0.1/com.ibm.itcamt.doc/ism/dita/ag/topic/ISM_install_elements.html?lang=en]\\\\n\\\\n- An Application support event - new indicator is displayed on these clients to tell the user that they need to recycle their client to apply new or modified application support.\\\\n\\\\n- If you are using the Tivoli Enterprise Portal desktop client, you must use the monitoring agent\'s installation images to install the Tivoli Enterprise Portal application support on each of the desktop clients.\\\\n\\\\n- If you are using the Tivoli Enterprise Portal browser client or Java™ WebStart client and you have the required user permissions to view the updated application, after the indicator is displayed, you can choose to close and restart these clients to see the new updates.\\\\n\\\\n- Clear the java cache on your TEP client systems before accessing the TEP GUI after your upgrade is complete.\\\\n(possibly useful technote for this :\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21631843 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21631843]\\\\n\\\\n- Generally speaking after the ISM application support has been deployed on all TEMS (hub and remote) and TEPS, it\'s safer to restart all these components (TEMS/TEPS), but not mandatory with SDA.\\\\n\\\\n- SDA function is only supported on ITM IBM Tivoli Monitoring V6.2.3 and later. So make sure that your ITM (TEMS/TEPS) environment is already at right level, or upgrade it.\\\\n\\\\n- ISM 74 prereqs ITM 6.23. fp3 at minimum, or ITM 6.30 fp1, see the \'prerequisites\' tab of this web page :\\\\nhttp://www-969.ibm.com/software/reports/compatibility/clarity-reports/report/html/softwareReqsForProductByComponent?deliverableId=1364203661236&duComponent=Miscellaneous_3F551130952E11E290021D5C0925FE1B [http://www-969.ibm.com/software/reports/compatibility/clarity-reports/report/html/softwareReqsForProductByComponent?deliverableId=1364203661236&duComponent=Miscellaneous_3F551130952E11E290021D5C0925FE1B]\\\\n\\\\n- If you have a ISM agent 7.3 co-resident on TEMS or TEPS system, and upgrade it to ISM v7.4, the installation process will attempt to stop automatically the co-resident ITM components like TEMS or TEPS, prior to running the upgrade; so you should be aware of that stop that is needed; so you can plan such upgrade at a time that is convenient for you, in order not to impact your environment and administrators or the monitoring solution currently in use.\\\\n\\\\n- We did identify however a possible issue AFTER the ISM 7.3 to 7.4 upgrade was done, if DNS monitor was in use :\\\\n\\\\nwhen redeploying the existing DNS profile to the new ISM agent, specifically one of the profiles was causing instant \\\\\\"out of sync\\\\\\" errors. For some reason it was identified that the DNS host field was using actual hostname values, and not IPs.\\\\n\\\\nThis clearly was allowed in the older ISM versions (pre 7.3.0.1), however ISM 7.4\'s data validation would only allow IPs in that field. Once change of those host values to the IP addresses was done, this resolved the issue with the profile and allowed it to be deployed against the systems without causing them to go out of sync.\\\\n\\\\nThe check for the DNS server being an IP address was not in some early ISM v7.3 code, so if using ISM version pre v7.3.0.1, the DNS server could set as a hostname.\\\\n\\\\nPRODUCT ALIAS/SYNONYM\\\\n itcam itcam4tx itcam4trans itcamfortrans itcamfortx internet services monitoring\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -4.9221,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"a2f680a5\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"a2f680a5-006\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 6,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"../my-agent-kb/docs/redis-docs/operate/oss_and_stack/management/sentinel.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"High availability with Redis Sentinel\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"Sentinel quick start > Example Sentinel deployments > Example 3: Sentinel in the client boxes\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"Sometimes we have only two Redis boxes available, one for the master and\\\\none for the replica. The configuration in the example 2 is not viable in\\\\nthat case, so we can resort to the following, where Sentinels are placed\\\\nwhere clients are:\\\\n\\\\n                +----+         +----+\\\\n                | M1 |----+----| R1 |\\\\n                |    |    |    |    |\\\\n                +----+    |    +----+\\\\n                          |\\\\n             +------------+------------+\\\\n             |            |            |\\\\n             |            |            |\\\\n          +----+        +----+      +----+\\\\n          | C1 |        | C2 |      | C3 |\\\\n          | S1 |        | S2 |      | S3 |\\\\n          +----+        +----+      +----+\\\\n\\\\n          Configuration: quorum = 2\\\\n\\\\nIn this setup, the point of view Sentinels is the same as the clients: if\\\\na master is reachable by the majority of the clients, it is fine.\\\\nC1, C2, C3 here are generic clients, it does not mean that C1 identifies\\\\na single client connected to Redis. It is more likely something like\\\\nan application server, a Rails app, or something like that.\\\\n\\\\nIf the box where M1 and S1 are running fails, the failover will happen\\\\nwithout issues, however it is easy to see that different network partitions\\\\nwill result in different behaviors. For example Sentinel will not be able\\\\nto setup if the network between the clients and the Redis servers is\\\\ndisconnected, since the Redis master and replica will both be unavailable.\\\\n\\\\nNote that if C3 gets partitioned with M1 (hardly possible with\\\\nthe network described above, but more likely possible with different\\\\nlayouts, or because of failures at the software layer), we have a similar\\\\nissue as described in Example 2, with the difference that here we have\\\\nno way to break the symmetry, since there is just a replica and master, so\\\\nthe master can\'t stop accepting queries when it is disconnected from its replica,\\\\notherwise the master would never be available during replica failures.\\\\n\\\\nSo this is a valid setup but the setup in the Example 2 has advantages\\\\nsuch as the HA system of Redis running in the same boxes as Redis itself\\\\nwhich may be simpler to manage, and the ability to put a bound on the amount\\\\nof time a master in the minority partition can receive writes.\\",\\n    \\"agent_hint\\": \\"[overview | gaps:incomplete_steps,missing_example]\\",\\n    \\"evidence_flags\\": {\\n      \\"has_command\\": true,\\n      \\"has_config\\": true,\\n      \\"has_code_block\\": false,\\n      \\"has_steps\\": true\\n    }\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -5.5453,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"37615ce5\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"37615ce5-004\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 4,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"../my-agent-kb/docs/redis-docs/operate/oss_and_stack/stack-with-enterprise/release-notes/redisearch/redisearch-2.6-release-notes.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"Redisearch 2.6 Release Notes\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"v2.6.17 (April 2024)\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"This is a maintenance release for RediSearch 2.6.\\\\n\\\\nUpdate urgency: `MODERATE`: Program an upgrade of the server, but it\'s not urgent.\\\\n\\\\n- Bug fixes:\\\\n\\\\n  - [TextBlock(text='根据我在知识库和IBM官方文档中的搜索，我找到了关于在多实例环境中为IBM Integration Bus (IIB)安装修复包的重要信息。让我为您总结关键要点：

## 在多实例环境中安装IIB修复包的重要考虑事项

### 1. **安装和验证任务**

**安装前准备：**
- 备份当前环境（包括配置文件、队列管理器数据）
- 停止所有broker实例和相关服务
- 记录当前版本信息以便验证

**安装步骤：**
- 使用IBM Installation Manager应用修复包
- 修复包会更新产品二进制文件，但不会影响broker配置
- 在多实例配置中，需要在所有运行broker的服务器上应用相同的修复包

**验证方法：**
- 使用命令检查版本：`mqsiversion` 或 `mqsilist`
- 验证broker能够正常启动
- 检查日志文件确认没有错误
- 测试基本消息流功能

### 2. **回退能力**

**重要提示：** 根据IBM文档，修复包（Fix Pack）通常**不支持直接回退**。这是因为：

- 修复包会更新产品二进制文件
- 一旦应用，无法通过简单的卸载恢复到之前版本
- 如果需要回退，通常需要：
  - 完全卸载当前版本
  - 重新安装之前的版本
  - 恢复配置和数据

**建议的风险缓解措施：**
- 在生产环境应用前，先在测试环境验证
- 创建完整的系统备份（包括文件系统和配置）
- 考虑使用虚拟机快照（如果在虚拟环境中）
- 准备回退计划，包括重新安装步骤

### 3. **多实例配置的特定任务**

**关键考虑：**

- **高可用性维护：** 在多实例broker配置中，可以利用HA特性进行滚动升级
  - 先停止备用实例，应用修复包
  - 启动并验证备用实例
  - 切换到已升级的实例
  - 对原主实例重复此过程

- **队列管理器兼容性：** 确保IBM MQ版本与IIB修复包兼容

- **共享文件系统：** 如果使用共享文件系统存储broker数据，确保所有节点都能访问更新后的文件

- **同步更新：** 所有参与多实例配置的服务器必须运行相同版本的IIB

**推荐流程：**
1. 在非生产环境测试修复包
2. 计划维护窗口
3. 备份所有系统
4. 按顺序更新每个实例
5. 验证每个实例后再继续
6. 监控系统稳定性

### 4. **额外建议**

- 查看修复包的发布说明，了解已修复的问题和已知限制
- 订阅IBM My Notifications以获取修复包发布通知
- 考虑应用最新的修复包以获得最佳稳定性和安全性
- 文档化您的升级过程以便将来参考

**重要提醒：** 由于修复包通常不支持简单回退，强烈建议在应用到生产环境前进行充分测试，并准备完整的灾难恢复计划。

## Sources:
- [Applying service to the Integration Bus component](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSMKHH_9.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/ah01589_.htm)
- [Coexistence and migration](https://www.ibm.com/docs/SSMKHH_9.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/bh25905_.htm)
- [Installing service on Windows](https://www.ibm.com/docs/SSMKHH_9.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/ah01591_.htm)
- [Verifying a fix pack installation](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/psfoa/1.1.0?topic=installation-verifying-fix-pack)
- [Resolving problems when you install IBM Integration Bus](https://www.ibm.com/docs/SSMKHH_10.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/bu16190_.htm)')]

## Sources:
- [Applying service to the Integration Bus component](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSMKHH_9.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/ah01589_.htm)

query: Is there a support's guide to the CORBA Probes? Where can I download the support's guide to the IBM CORBA probes?
answer:
根据知识库检索结果，我找到了关于 IBM CORBA Probes 支持指南的信息：

## 回答

**是的，IBM CORBA Probes 有支持指南。**

### 下载地址

您可以从以下链接下载 **Support's Guide to IBM CORBA probes**：

**http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21614208**

文档名称为：`GENERIC_CORBA_SupportsGuide_20.pdf`

### 相关信息

- Visibroker 软件在 2012 年被 IBM CORBA 软件取代
- 该支持指南帮助理解 IBM CORBA 集成，应与具体探针的文档一起阅读
- 新的探针使用 IBM JRE 中提供的 ORB（对象请求代理），该 JRE 包含在 Netcool/OMNIbus 基础安装中

### 其他支持指南

如果需要查找其他支持指南，可以在 Netcool/OMNIbus 搜索门户中使用搜索文本 "Support's Guide [product]" 来查找相关文档。

Network Manager also integrates topology and alert data with IBM Tivoli Netcool/OMNIbus so that operators can visualize and understand the layout of complex networks, and diagnose and solve network problems in real time.\\\\n\\\\nAfter logging into IBM\'s Passport Advantage Online [http://www.ibm.com/software/howtobuy/passportadvantage/pao_customers.htm] Web site, click Software download & media access, then click Download finder, then select Find by product description and type in Tivoli Network Manager. Expand the Tivoli Software eAssembly, and select the images you wish to download from that list. All Tivoli Network Manager IP Edition download images are described below.\\\\n\\\\nDownloading and assembling the product\\\\n\\\\n 1. Download all of the parts that you need, both required and optional. The parts are listed by operating system in the tabs below.\\\\n 2. Unpack each of the parts into a single temporary directory on your system. If you want Network Manager to install IBM Tivoli Netcool/OMNIbus, do not rename the Tivoli Netcool/OMNIbus package.\\\\n 3. Follow the instructions in the Quick Start Guide to install the product.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTo see the part numbers for your platform, click the appropriate link below.\\\\n\\\\n[http://www.ibm.com/i/c.gif] [http://www.ibm.com/i/c.gif] AIX [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=3118&uid=swg24028958] [http://www.ibm.com/i/c.gif] Linux [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=3118&uid=swg24028957] [http://www.ibm.com/i/c.gif] Linux zSeries [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=3118&uid=swg24028956] 3 [http://www.ibm.com/i/c.gif] Solaris [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=3118&uid=swg24028955] [http://www.ibm.com/i/c.gif] Windows [http://www.ibm.com/i/c.gif] [http://www.ibm.com/i/c.gif] Supported operating systems\\\\n\\\\nOn Intel x86 processor and chipset-based platforms, these versions are supported:\\\\n\\\\n * Windows Server 2008 Enterprise Edition (x86-32 and x86-64)\\\\n * Windows Server 2008 Standard Edition\\\\n * Windows Server 2008 Datacenter Edition\\\\n\\\\nDownloadable parts\\\\n\\\\nThere are downloadable parts for each supported platform upon which IBM Tivoli Network Manager IP Edition can be installed. Refer to the tables below for details about what each part contains. docs/ragbench-techqa/8d10cae8.md:21:The Visibroker CORBA software is being phased out of the integrations product line. query:
Traffic across domains seems unexpected 

I have two Multi-Protocol Gateways (MPGWs) configured, each in their own domain:

     Domain A
     MPGW_A
     FSH_A (1.2.3.4:443)
     Domain B
     MPGW_B
     FSH_B (0.0.0.0:443)

The FSH_B is disabled, thus MPGW_B cannot take traffic. However, if I modify the config for MPGW_B (i.e. just change a Stylesheet parameter) the traffic goes to MPGW_B somehow. How is this happening? FSH_B is still disabled.
answer:
根据知识库检索结果，我没有找到直接针对您描述的"跨域流量异常"问题的文档。不过，基于您的问题描述和 DataPower 的工作原理，我可以分析可能的原因：

## 问题分析

您遇到的情况是：
- **Domain A** 的 MPGW_A 使用 FSH_A (1.2.3.4:443)
- **Domain B** 的 MPGW_B 使用 FSH_B (0.0.0.0:443) - **已禁用**
- 当修改 MPGW_B 配置时，流量却进入了 MPGW_B

## 可能的原因

**1. 端口冲突和通配符地址 (0.0.0.0)**

FSH_B 配置为 `0.0.0.0:443`，这是一个通配符地址，意味着它会监听所有网络接口的 443 端口。即使 FSH_B 被标记为"禁用"，当您修改 MPGW_B 配置时：

- 配置变更可能触发了 FSH_B 的短暂激活或重新加载
- `0.0.0.0:443` 会与 `1.2.3.4:443` 产生端口绑定竞争
- DataPower 可能在配置保存/应用时临时启用了该 FSH

**2. 配置保存时的状态变化**

修改 MPGW_B 的配置（如 Stylesheet 参数）时，DataPower 会：
- 重新加载相关对象
- 可能临时改变 FSH 的状态
- 在配置应用过程中，FSH_B 可能被短暂启用

## 建议的解决方案

1. **更改 FSH_B 的监听地址**
   - 将 `0.0.0.0:443` 改为特定 IP 地址（如 `5.6.7.8:443`）
   - 避免使用通配符地址造成的端口冲突

2. **使用不同的端口**
   - 如果两个 MPGW 必须在同一设备上，考虑使用不同端口
   - 例如：FSH_A 使用 443，FSH_B 使用 8443

3. **检查路由和静态路由配置**
   - 根据知识库文档，DataPower 的路由配置可能影响流量走向
   - 确认没有配置导致流量被错误路由到 Domain B

4. **完全删除而非禁用**
   - 如果 MPGW_B 暂时不需要使用，考虑完全删除 FSH_B 配置
   - 而不是仅仅禁用它

5. **检查日志**
   - 查看 DataPower 日志，确认配置变更时 FSH_B 的状态变化
   - 使用 `show service-status` 命令查看服务状态

## 验证步骤

```bash
# 检查当前监听的端口
show tcp-table

# 查看服务状态
show service-status

# 检查路由配置
show route
```

**关键点**：`0.0.0.0:443` 的通配符监听是最可能的原因。即使 FSH 被禁用，配置变更时的重新加载可能导致它临时接管流量。

Appliance Service to proxy an SSL request to a remote proxy server using the CONNECT method for SSL tunneling?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nMany common forward proxy servers expect requests in different formats depending on if they are proxying non-SSL or SSL requests.\\\\n\\\\nFor example, a non-SSL request to be proxied may come in the form of GET hostname:port/URI.\\\\n\\\\nFor SSL requests to be proxied, remote proxy servers are commonly configured to tunnel the request from the client to the backend server.\\\\n\\\\nIn the SSL request scenario, remote proxy servers will typically expect a CONNECT request and then tunnel the SSL request from the client to the backend server.\\\\n\\\\nUsers configuring DataPower may need a way to implement this CONNECT method for SSL tunneling to a remote Proxy Server.\\\\n\\\\nRESOLVING THE PROBLEM\\\\nNon-SSL Proxy requests will work using either:\\\\n\\\\na) an XML Firewall when configuring in the HTTP Options tab, where the user can configure the Proxy Host and Port\\\\n\\\\nb) a Multi-Protocol Gateway when configuring an HTTP Proxy Policy in the User Agent\\\\n\\\\nSSL Proxy requests will work using the CONNECT method for SSL Tunneling when using a Multi-Protocol Gateway when configuring in a User Agent\'s HTTP Proxy Policy.\\\\n\\\\nThe XML Firewall service is not designed to use the CONNECT method for SSL Tunneling.\\"\\n },\\n {\\n ERROR.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nERROR DESCRIPTION\\\\n * Affected are customers sending HTTP GET requests to the\\\\n multiprotocol gateway, web service proxy or web application\\\\n firewall service.\\\\n\\\\n With the present implementation, users may end up in a state\\\\n with indefinite retries for HTTP GET requests as long as\\\\n DataPower has at least one live persistent connection to the\\\\n backend server. After timeout interval for active connection it\\\\n will terminate the connection and retry using remaining\\\\n persistent connections to the backend. (If a new connection is\\\\n opened because of half-dead backend this can continue\\\\n indefinitely or until the request is served).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLOCAL FIX\\\\n * This behavior cannot be turned off however it can be mitigated.\\\\n For some relief out of this, the admin can lower the Back\\\\n Persistent Timeout and/or User Agent\'s default Timeout. This\\\\n should result in less persistent connections to the backend and\\\\n thus less possible timeout hops\\\\n\\\\n Dropping the backend persistent connections option is also a\\\\n possible workaround, but the consequences should be weighed\\\\n carefully before making this decision. Not using persistent\\\\n connections comes with a performance penalty, but it very much\\\\n depends on the size/type of the transferred data and the\\\\n speed/ping of the network.\\\\n\\\\n SLM is also strongly encouraged to prevent the backend from\\\\n getting more load than it can handle.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM SUMMARY\\\\n * Affected are all customers using the Multi-Protocol Gateway,\\\\n Web Service Proxy or Web Application Firewall with persistent\\\\n connection to the backend side.\\\\n\\\\n In case the backend server stops responding to HTTP GET\\\\n requests while there are already some established TCP\\\\n connections from the time the server worked OK, DataPower will\\\\n automatically retry those GET requests after a timeout period.\\\\n This will be retried until there are no established connections\\\\n to the server.\\\\n\\\\n During a high load window, these unwanted retries might\\\\n eventually keep flooding an already congested backend,\\\\n especially if it is still able to establish some new\\\\n connections.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM CONCLUSION\\\\n * Fix is available in 6.0.0.16, 6.0.1.12, 7.0.0.9, 7.1.0.6 and\\\\n 7.2.0.2.\\\\n\\\\n For a list of the latest fix packs available, please see:\\\\n http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21237631 {\\n \\"score\\": -5.9448,\\n \\"doc_id\\": \\"b35766e5\\",\\n \\"chunk_id\\": \\"b35766e5-000\\",\\n \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/b35766e5.md\\",\\n \\"title\\": \\"datapower; routing; route; default; static; gateway; default gateway; static rou\\",\\n \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n \\"text\\": \\"datapower; routing; route; default; static; gateway; default gateway; static route TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM(ABSTRACT)\\\\n The default route and static routes on the DataPower appliance have different functionality and behavior.\\\\n\\\\nRESOLVING THE PROBLEM\\\\nA static route forces the DataPower appliance to use a specific interface and a specific set of network hops to access a given set of destinations. The \\\\\\"default route\\\\\\" is created by setting the Default Gateway of an interface on a DataPower appliance.\\\\n\\\\nA default route will be used if a known route does not exist for a given destination address. If multiple default routes are configured, the appliance will randomly pick which interface to use for outbound traffic if a more specific route cannot be found.\\\\n\\\\nIf you want your network traffic to follow a specific route, set a static route and NOT rely on the default gateway. As a general rule, the management interface should not have the default gateway set, as you generally want to restrict the connections that can be made through that interface.\\\\n\\\\nA general recommendation is to set specific static routes and only ONE default gateway that will catch all traffic not being directed by the static routes.\\\\n\\\\nConsider the following example after running this command from the CLI:\\\\n\\\\nxs40# show route\\\\n\\\\ndestination interface gateway metric 0.0.0.0/0 eth0 167.91.8.1 0 0.0.0.0/0 eth1 167.91.7.1 0 0.0.0.0/0 mgt0 10.238.77.1 0 10.238.77.0/24 mgt0 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21249208&aid=1] 0 167.81.18.0/23 eth0 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21249208&aid=1] 0 167.81.18.0/23 eth1 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21249208&aid=1] 0\\\\n\\\\nThe output above shows that three default gateways were configured on eth0, eth1, and mgt0 which causes three \\\\\\"default\\\\\\" route to be generated (0.0.0.0/0). If the destination address of your service is 166.84.23.4, the device will randomly choose any one of the default routes as no specific route is configured. If, for example, the gateway picked is 10.238.77.1 and the gateway does not know how to route to the needed backend server ip address, this will cause unexpected connection failures. In the case of such failure, a reboot of the device will lead to a different route to be randomly picked, thus temporarily resolving until the next failure.\\\\n\\\\nFirmware 3.7.2 and later\\\\n\\\\nInstructions for setting the default gateway and for setting a static route can be found in the \\\\\\"Managing the appliance\\\\\\" section of the Administrators Guide. The command line commands are ip default-gateway and ip route respectively, and more information is available in the CLI Reference Guide.\\\\n\\\\nFirmware earlier than 3.7.2\\\\n\\\\nInstructions for setting the default gateway and static routes can be found in the \\\\\\"Ethernet Interface\\\\\\" appendix of the WebGUI Guide. The command line commands are ip default-gateway and ip route respectively, and more information is available in the CLI Reference Guide.\\\\n\\\\nTo access product documentation, see these instructions. [TextBlock(text='根据知识库检索结果，我没有找到直接针对您描述的"跨域流量异常"问题的文档。不过，基于您的问题描述和 DataPower 的工作原理，我可以分析可能的原因：

## 问题分析

您遇到的情况是：
- **Domain A** 的 MPGW_A 使用 FSH_A (1.2.3.4:443)
- **Domain B** 的 MPGW_B 使用 FSH_B (0.0.0.0:443) - **已禁用**
- 当修改 MPGW_B 配置时，流量却进入了 MPGW_B

## 可能的原因

**1. 端口冲突和通配符地址 (0.0.0.0)**

FSH_B 配置为 `0.0.0.0:443`，这是一个通配符地址，意味着它会监听所有网络接口的 443 端口。即使 FSH_B 被标记为"禁用"，当您修改 MPGW_B 配置时：

- 配置变更可能触发了 FSH_B 的短暂激活或重新加载
- `0.0.0.0:443` 会与 `1.2.3.4:443` 产生端口绑定竞争
- DataPower 可能在配置保存/应用时临时启用了该 FSH

**2. 配置保存时的状态变化**

修改 MPGW_B 的配置（如 Stylesheet 参数）时，DataPower 会：
- 重新加载相关对象
- 可能临时改变 FSH 的状态
- 在配置应用过程中，FSH_B 可能被短暂启用

## 建议的解决方案

1. **更改 FSH_B 的监听地址**
   - 将 `0.0.0.0:443` 改为特定 IP 地址（如 `5.6.7.8:443`）
   - 避免使用通配符地址造成的端口冲突

2. **使用不同的端口**
   - 如果两个 MPGW 必须在同一设备上，考虑使用不同端口
   - 例如：FSH_A 使用 443，FSH_B 使用 8443

3. **检查路由和静态路由配置**
   - 根据知识库文档，DataPower 的路由配置可能影响流量走向
   - 确认没有配置导致流量被错误路由到 Domain B

4. **完全删除而非禁用**
   - 如果 MPGW_B 暂时不需要使用，考虑完全删除 FSH_B 配置
   - 而不是仅仅禁用它

5. **检查日志**
   - 查看 DataPower 日志，确认配置变更时 FSH_B 的状态变化
   - 使用 `show service-status` 命令查看服务状态

## 验证步骤

```bash
# 检查当前监听的端口
show tcp-table

# 查看服务状态
show service-status

# 检查路由配置
show route
```

**关键点**：`0.0.0.0:443` 的通配符监听是最可能的原因。即使 FSH 被禁用，配置变更时的重新加载可能导致它临时接管流量。')]

根据知识库检索结果，我没有找到直接针对您描述的"跨域流量异常"问题的文档。不过，基于您的问题描述和 DataPower 的工作原理，我可以分析可能的原因：

## 问题分析

您遇到的情况是：
- **Domain A** 的 MPGW_A 使用 FSH_A (1.2.3.4:443)
- **Domain B** 的 MPGW_B 使用 FSH_B (0.0.0.0:443) - **已禁用**
- 当修改 MPGW_B 配置时，流量却进入了 MPGW_B

## 可能的原因

**1. 端口冲突和通配符地址 (0.0.0.0)**

FSH_B 配置为 `0.0.0.0:443`，这是一个通配符地址，意味着它会监听所有网络接口的 443 端口。即使 FSH_B 被标记为"禁用"，当您修改 MPGW_B 配置时：

- 配置变更可能触发了 FSH_B 的短暂激活或重新加载
- `0.0.0.0:443` 会与 `1.2.3.4:443` 产生端口绑定竞争
- DataPower 可能在配置保存/应用时临时启用了该 FSH

**2. 配置保存时的状态变化**

修改 MPGW_B 的配置（如 Stylesheet 参数）时，DataPower 会：
- 重新加载相关对象
- 可能临时改变 FSH 的状态
- 在配置应用过程中，FSH_B 可能被短暂启用

## 建议的解决方案

1. **更改 FSH_B 的监听地址**
   - 将 `0.0.0.0:443` 改为特定 IP 地址（如 `5.6.7.8:443`）
   - 避免使用通配符地址造成的端口冲突

2. **使用不同的端口**
   - 如果两个 MPGW 必须在同一设备上，考虑使用不同端口
   - 例如：FSH_A 使用 443，FSH_B 使用 8443

3. **检查路由和静态路由配置**
   - 根据知识库文档，DataPower 的路由配置可能影响流量走向
   - 确认没有配置导致流量被错误路由到 Domain B

4. **完全删除而非禁用**
   - 如果 MPGW_B 暂时不需要使用，考虑完全删除 FSH_B 配置
   - 而不是仅仅禁用它

5. **检查日志**
   - 查看 DataPower 日志，确认配置变更时 FSH_B 的状态变化
   - 使用 `show service-status` 命令查看服务状态

## 验证步骤

```bash
# 检查当前监听的端口
show tcp-table

# 查看服务状态
show service-status

# 检查路由配置
show route
```

**关键点**：`0.0.0.0:443` 的通配符监听是最可能的原因。即使 FSH 被禁用，配置变更时的重新加载可能导致它临时接管流量。

query:
Additional steps to apply fix pack to Decision Center 

We are upgrading ODM 8.8.1 Decision Center to the latest 8.8.1.3.

Are there any additional steps to apply the fixpack to Decision Center after we install the fixpack with Installation Manager?
answer:
根据知识库检索结果，关于在使用 Installation Manager 安装 ODM 8.8.1.3 fix pack 后，Decision Center 是否需要额外步骤的问题：

## 答案

**是的，需要额外步骤。**

安装 fix pack 后，您需要完成以下操作来真正应用 fix pack 到您的环境：

### 必须执行的额外步骤：

1. **更新应用服务器上的 Decision Center 应用**
   - 更新 `jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear` 文件到应用服务器
   - 确保不要改变应用和模块的类加载策略（所有 ODM 模块保持 parent last）

2. **重新应用产品定制**
   - 将之前对 Java EE 模块（EARs 和 WARs）的所有定制重新应用到更新后的文件
   - 建议使用脚本记录和自动化这些定制，使过程更简单且不易出错

3. **重新打包客户端应用**
   - 使用更新后的库重新打包您的客户端应用程序

### 重要说明：

- Fix pack 安装只更新了安装目录中的 JAR 库和 EAR/WAR 应用文件
- **不需要数据迁移** - 您的项目和数据库保持不变
- 使用与之前部署时相同的设置重新部署应用

### 参考文档：

完整的步骤和注意事项请参考 IBM 官方文档：
- [When and how to apply a modification or fix pack](http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665766)

**Sources:**
- [IBM ODM Fix Pack Application Guide](docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md)
- [ODM 8.5.1.1 Fix Pack Documentation](docs/ragbench-techqa/dcaea221.md)

\\"08ceb9a6-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"fix pack update bug correction APAR TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"fix pack update bug correction APAR TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n When and how should I apply a modification or fix pack to my JRules or Operational Decision Management (WODM/ODM) installation?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nThe Operational Decision Manager version numbers use the standard IBM formatV.R.M.Fwhich stands for Version.Release.Modification.Fixpack. See the V.R.M.F Maintenance Stream Delivery Vehicle terminology explanation [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27008656] for more details.\\\\n\\\\nModification and fix pack numbers are the third and fourth digits in the IBM product version number, for example: 8.5.M.F.\\\\n\\\\nModification and fix packs include only bug fixes, so they do not affect the product functionality or your data.\\\\n\\\\nSee the following technotes to find out which update your installation need:\\\\n\\\\n * Finding the version of ODM product and fixes [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21627850] to determine the exact product versions that are installed on your machine.\\\\n\\\\n * Find the version of ODM components [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21400738] to determine the exact module or library versions that are deployed on your servers.\\\\n\\\\n * Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] to learn about the latest modification or fix pack that is available for your product version.\\\\n\\\\n * IBM Operational Decision Manager detailed system requirements [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27023067] to verify that your configuration is supported with your current product version.\\\\n\\\\n * IBM Support Lifecycle [http://www.ibm.com/software/websphere/support/lifecycle/] to verify that your current version does not reach end of support in the near future.\\\\n\\\\nReferring to the last two documents above, you may find out that you need to migrate to the latest product version to ensure continued support of your applications. In that case, refer to technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725].\\\\n\\\\nThat being said, make sure to consider migrating to the latest version or release ( V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from the latest added features and improvements.\\\\nANSWER\\\\nAs with any software product, even if you do not have any issues with running your current configuration, you should apply the latest modification or fix pack to take advantage of these benefits:\\\\n\\\\n * Anticipate and avoid the risk of encountering defects already fixed.\\\\n * Apply the latest product improvements that are available (performance, for example).\\\\n * Maintain a serviceable system and be able to install an interim fix when required.\\\\n\\\\nWHEN TO UPDATE\\\\nThe latest modification or fix pack should be installed as soon as it is available.\\\\n\\\\nYou can subscribe to the IBM Support My Notifications [https://www.ibm.com/support/mynotifications] to be notified of any fix pack releases, and you can also bookmark the Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] page, which lists the latest modifications or fix packs.\\\\n\\\\nSee the technote Fix pack release notification for Operational Decision Manager [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665593] to find out when a modification or fix pack will be available.\\\\n\\\\nBEFORE UPDATING\\\\n\\\\nThe databases used in the sample server are deleted and recreated during the update. If you are using those databases and want to save the existing content, perform the following steps before updating:\\\\n *  Stop the sample server. In the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby, create an archive file containing the resdb and rtsdb folders. Save the archive file, such as zip file, in the data folder. After installation, unzip the archive file in the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby to restore your databases before restarting the sample server.\\\\n\\\\nA new profile is also created for the sample server, at the first server start following the installation of a modification or fix pack.\\\\n\\\\nIf you want to continue using the same ports, you must delete the existing profile prior. In the <ODM_HOME>/shared/bin folder, from the command line, run the command ../tools/ant/bin/ant forcedestroyprofile.\\\\n\\\\nNote: The sample server is not designed to be used in a production system. For a production system, you must create a dedicated profile and database that you update using the following steps.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATING\\\\n\\\\nEach modification or fix pack page provides instructions on how to download and run the installer, in addition to providing a list of corrections that are included in the update.\\\\n\\\\nThe fix pack installation updates the following files and folders:  * JAR libraries in the installation directories, including <ODMInstallDir>\\\\\\\\<Module>\\\\\\\\lib.\\\\n * EAR and WAR applications in the <ODMInstallDir>\\\\\\\\<Module>\\\\\\\\applicationservers\\\\\\\\<App Server> folders.\\\\n\\\\nOnce this is done, you perform these tasks:  * Repackage your client applications with the up-to-date libraries.\\\\n * Reapply product customizations to the up-to-date Java EE modules (EARs and WARs).\\\\n\\\\nNote that all customizations you developed before the update, for example modifications of the descriptors, must be reapplied to the new, up-to-date EARs and WARs. It is a good idea to document and automate those customizations using scripts to make the process easier and error-proof.\\\\n\\\\nFinally, you must update the client applications and ODM modules on your server or servers with the same settings as you deployed previously. If you redeploy the application, follow again the documentation instructions to deploy all ODM modules to your servers [http://pic.dhe.ibm.com/infocenter/dmanager/v8r5m1/topic/com.ibm.odm.distrib.config/topics/odm_distrib_config.html].\\\\n\\\\nKeep in mind that applying a modification or a fix pack does not require any data migration, so your projects and database remain the same.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATING RULE EXECUTION SERVER\\\\n\\\\nUpdate the following applications in the application server:  *  jrules-res-xu-<server>.rar jrules-res-management-<server>.ear jrules-ssp-<server>.ear jrules-res-htds-<server>ear\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nNote: Updating the eXecution Unit RAR file requires a restart of the server.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATE DECISION CENTER\\\\n\\\\nUpdate the following application in your application server:\\\\n * jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nUPDATE THE EVENTS RUNTIME\\\\n\\\\n 1. Stop the event runtime application, wberuntimeear.\\\\n 2. Uninstall the following applications, if they exist:  * wbefileconnector\\\\n     * wbehttpconnector\\\\n     * wbejdbcconnector\\\\n     * wbejmsconnector\\\\n     * wbesoapconnector\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. Update the application wberuntimeear.\\\\n 4. Start the application wberuntimeear.\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nADDITIONAL CONSIDERATIONS\\\\n * Again, in addition to applying the latest modification or fix pack, consider migrating to the latest version or release (V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from recently added features and improvements. See our technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725] for more information.\\\\n * For JRules 7.1, you can refer to the JRules 7.1 list of fix packs [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27019787] and also Upgrading JRules to the latest V7.1 fix pack [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21474292] to learn how to apply the fix packs. But note that JRules 7.1 reaches end of support in September 2015 (see the IBM Support Lifecycle [http://www.ibm.com/software/websphere/support/lifecycle/] page). To ensure continued product support, plan an upgrade to the latest product version before that date.\\\\n\\\\nRELATED INFORMATION\\\\n Fix pack release notification for ODM [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665593 ]\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCross reference information Segment Product Component Platform Version Edition Business Integration WebSphere ILOG JRules \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n How to resolve \\\\\\"ZeroGur: Windows DLL failed to load\\\\\\" error when installing IBM Decision Optimization Center 3.9 on Windows 10?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nIBM Decision Optimization Center 3.9 is not officially supported on Windows 10.\\\\n\\\\nANSWER\\\\nThis error occurs when installing the JViews component in IBM Decision Optimization Center 3.9 on Windows 10.\\\\n\\\\nThere are two ways to get around this:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n1. Install IBM Decision Optimization Center 3.9 without checking the JViews component, the installation will go through.\\\\n\\\\nThen install JViews manually:\\\\n- launch <DocInstallPath>\\\\\\\\Developer\\\\\\\\redist\\\\\\\\JViews\\\\\\\\jviewsenterprise-8.8.exe,\\\\n- then install JViews fixpack:\\\\nin <DocInstallPath>\\\\\\\\Developer\\\\\\\\redist\\\\\\\\JViews run the following 3 commands (run as admin):\\\\nset PATH=%PATH%;\\\\\\"<DocInstallPath>\\\\\\\\Developer\\\\\\\\sdk\\\\\\\\bin\\\\\\"\\\\ncd /D <DocInstallPath>\\\\\\\\Developer\\\\\\\\redist\\\\\\\\JViews\\\\n\\\\\\"<DocInstallPath>\\\\\\\\Developer\\\\\\\\sdk\\\\\\\\bin\\\\\\\\java.exe\\\\\\" -jar \\\\\\"<DocInstallPath>\\\\\\\\Developer\\\\\\\\redist\\\\\\\\JViews\\\\\\\\jviewsenterprise-8.8_11.jar\\\\\\".\\\\n\\\\n2. Install IBM Decision Optimization Center 3.9 by launching the executable file \\\\\\"odme_developer.exe\\\\\\" in Windows 7 compatible mode:\\\\n- in DOC_Developer_V3.9_Win_x86-64\\\\\\\\Disk1\\\\\\\\InstData\\\\\\\\VM\\\\\\\\ right click on odme_developer.exe and go to \\\\\\"Properties\\\\\\",\\\\n- in \\\\\\"Compatibility\\\\\\" tab, check \\\\\\"Run this program in compatibility mode for:\\\\\\" and select \\\\\\"Windows 7\\\\\\" (cannot change compatibility mode if .bat),\\\\n- then launch odme_developer.exe (check JViews install check box).\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -3.0461,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"553c70bc\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"553c70bc-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/553c70bc.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"embedded WAS; eWAS; embedded WebSphere Application Server; TEPS; fix pack; porta\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"embedded WAS; eWAS; embedded WebSphere Application Server; TEPS; fix pack; portal server; ITM; upgrade eWAS; security TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n How do we install maintenance for the embedded WebSphere Application Server and the IBM HTTP Server provided by IBM Tivoli Monitoring V6.2.3?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nIBM Tivoli Monitoring (ITM) provides embedded WebSphere Application Server (eWAS) and IBM HTTP Server (IHS) for use with Tivoli Enterprise Portal Sever (TEPS). For maintenance purposes it may be necessary to install fix packs and/or interim fixes for eWAS and IHS.\\\\nYou can use this procedure to install fix packs and interim fixes for a given eWAS and IHS version, but not to upgrade to a new eWAS or IHS version. For example, you can use it to install eWAS 7.0.0.43 on top of eWAS 7.0.0.29, but you cannot use it to install eWAS version 8.0 on top of eWAS version 7.0.\\\\nThe following table shows the different levels of eWAS and IHS that are provided by 6.2.3:\\\\n\\\\nITM version eWAS version IHS version 6.23.05.00 7.0.0.29 7.0.0.00 6.23.03.00 - 6.23.04.00 7.0.0.25 7.0.0.00 6.23.01.00 - 6.23.02.00 7.0.0.19 7.0.0.00 6.23.00.00 7.0.0.15 7.0.0.00\\\\nThis technote applies specifically to eWAS, not the full version of WebSphere. Further, this technote applies only to V6.2.3 of ITM.\\\\nANSWER\\\\nFollow these steps to install a new eWAS fix pack into your ITM environment:\\\\n\\\\nStep 1. Back up your ITM environment.\\\\nBack up your ITM environment using your local procedures.\\\\n\\\\nStep 2. Download the maintenance installation scripts.\\\\nDownload the appropriate eWAS/IHS maintenance installation script to the system where your TEPS resides.\\\\nUnix/Linux: Download ewasihsv7update.sh attached below. Ensure that the script has execute permission after it has been downloaded.\\\\nls -l ./ewasihsv7update.sh\\\\nchmod a+rx ./ewasihsv7update.sh\\\\nWindows: Download ewasihsv7update.cmd attached below.\\\\n\\\\nStep 3. Generate the list of files that need to be downloaded.\\\\nRun ewasihsv7update.sh or ewasihsv7update.cmd to generate the list of files that need to be downloaded and to create the temporary directory to hold them.\\\\nWhen the prompt beginning with \\\\\\"Have all required files been downloaded to\\\\\\" is displayed,\\\\nrespond with n to exit the script so that you can download the required files.\\\\n\\\\nThe usage information for the command follows:\\\\n\\\\n * Unix:\\\\n   ewasihsv7update.sh [-h candle_directory] [-w working_directory] [-u updateinstaller directory]\\\\n   -h Fully qualified path of the ITM installation directory.\\\\n   -w Fully qualified path of the temporary working directory for file downloads.\\\\n   -u Fully qualified path of the UpdateInstaller installation directory.\\\\n   If ewasihsv7update.sh was downloaded to CANDLEHOME/bin/, then the -h option is not needed.\\\\n   The working directory default value is: /tmp/ewasihsv7. \\"title\\": \\"admin.passwd; index.html TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"admin.passwd; index.html TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM(ABSTRACT)\\\\n Use of Installation Manager (IM) to install IBM HTTP Server (IHS webserver) starts with IHS version 8.0.0.0. Prior to use of IM, the fixpacks for IHS (V7 and V6.x) did not include files expected to be customized such as default static content files like index.html and other HTML, GIF, and ICO files installed by IHS to its <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs directory. More importantly the admin.passwd file (that holds the user/passsword for the IHS Admin Service) is usually configured right after install when using the Plugin Configration Tool (PCT).\\\\n\\\\nPrior to use of IM you could not install directly to a fixpack level. You had to install the base GA code (i.e. 7.0.0.0 or 6.1.0.0) and then use the Update Installer to apply fixpacks. IM supports installation directly to a fixpack level therefore all install files included with the base GA code 8.0.0.0 are applied with the fixpack. Any files that should not be overwritten must be listed in a exception list (of non-serviceable files) that the IM installer can reference. This list of non-serviceable files was ommitted or incomplete for IHS V8.0.0.0 and 8.5.0.0 so the install of the first fixpack (regardless of fixpack level) may overwrite files such as admin.passwd and index.html.\\\\n\\\\nThere are two APAR related to the same event:\\\\n.\\\\nPM71612: ADDITIONAL NON-SERVICEABLE FILES ADDED FOR IBM HTTP SERVER.\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM71612 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM71612]\\\\n.\\\\nPM63634: IHS CONFIG ADMIN.PASSWD FILE WAS RESET AFTER INSTALLING\\\\nFIXPACK 3 ON WAS 8.0.0.2 or 7.0.0.25 on Windows.\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM63634 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM63634]\\\\n\\\\n.\\\\nThe technote about PM63634: IHS CONFIG ADMIN.PASSWD FILE WAS RESET advises a resolution in reseting the admin.passwd file:\\\\n\\\\nInstallation of IBM HTTP Server 7.0.0.25, 8.0.0.1, 8.0.0.2, 8.0.0.3 will overlay admin.passwd:\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21593118 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21593118]\\\\n\\\\nThe main impact is that the IHS admin.passwd file gets overwritten which means the IHS Admin User/PW must be reset with the htpasswd utility in the IHS bin directory. Some customers customize the IHS splash page (index.html) or other default pages provided by IHS install so apply of first fixpack can overwrite these files and the customer\'s customization.\\\\n\\\\nThe list of these non-serviceable files where included in 8.0.0.5 and 8.5.0.1 per the APAR links above so once that fixpack level is applied then any future fixpacks will not overwrite these files. There is no way to avoid the event if GA 8.0.0.0/8.5.0.0 IHS is installed first. The first fixpack applied (of any fixpack) could replace the files.\\\\n\\\\nThis Technote defines three recommendations to avoid the problem.\\\\n\\\\nSYMPTOM\\\\n- The admin.passwd is a zero byte file after apply of fixpack\\\\n\\\\n - Any content installed under <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs by IHS install (default static content files) that have been customized are replaced by their default originals after apply of fixpack\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nFiles not marked as non-serviceable files for IM install of fixpacks for IHS per APAR PM71612\\\\n\\\\nENVIRONMENT\\\\nWebSphere environments that use IHS v8.x to run the WSAS plugin for Webservers to act as proxy front to WSAS appservers.\\\\n\\\\nRESOLVING THE PROBLEM\\\\nSupport suggests one of three recommendations to avoid the problem:\\\\n\\\\n1. Use IM to install IHS at fixpack 8.0.0.5/8.5.0.1 or higher bypassing the install of 8.0.0.0/8.5.0.0\\\\n\\\\n2. Do not use PCT, configure IHS Admin or use htpasswd (or other customization/config) until after fixpack has been applied.\\\\n\\\\n3. If you have already installed 8.0.0.0 or 8.5.0.0 then before you apply your first IHS fixpack backup these files:\\\\n\\\\n- admin.passwd\\\\n\\\\n- all content under <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPRODUCT ALIAS/SYNONYM\\\\n IHS\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -3.4532,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"289c423d\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"289c423d-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/289c423d.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"IBM Packaging Utility; Version 1005 fix pack; Packaging Utility; v1005; fix pack\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"IBM Packaging Utility; Version 1005 fix pack; Packaging Utility; v1005; fix pack 1005; 1005; fix pack DOWNLOADABLE FILES\\\\n\\\\nABSTRACT\\\\n This document describes how to download and install this fix pack to IBM Packaging Utility, Version 1.0.\\\\n\\\\nDOWNLOAD DESCRIPTION\\\\nIMPORTANT: This update has been superseded and is no longer available for download from ibm.com. [TextBlock(text='根据知识库检索结果，关于在使用 Installation Manager 安装 ODM 8.8.1.3 fix pack 后，Decision Center 是否需要额外步骤的问题：

## 答案

**是的，需要额外步骤。**

安装 fix pack 后，您需要完成以下操作来真正应用 fix pack 到您的环境：

### 必须执行的额外步骤：

1. **更新应用服务器上的 Decision Center 应用**
   - 更新 `jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear` 文件到应用服务器
   - 确保不要改变应用和模块的类加载策略（所有 ODM 模块保持 parent last）

2. **重新应用产品定制**
   - 将之前对 Java EE 模块（EARs 和 WARs）的所有定制重新应用到更新后的文件
   - 建议使用脚本记录和自动化这些定制，使过程更简单且不易出错

3. **重新打包客户端应用**
   - 使用更新后的库重新打包您的客户端应用程序

### 重要说明：

- Fix pack 安装只更新了安装目录中的 JAR 库和 EAR/WAR 应用文件
- **不需要数据迁移** - 您的项目和数据库保持不变
- 使用与之前部署时相同的设置重新部署应用

### 参考文档：

完整的步骤和注意事项请参考 IBM 官方文档：
- [When and how to apply a modification or fix pack](http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665766)

**Sources:**
- [IBM ODM Fix Pack Application Guide](docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md)
- [ODM 8.5.1.1 Fix Pack Documentation](docs/ragbench-techqa/dcaea221.md)')]

messages.result:
根据知识库检索结果，关于在使用 Installation Manager 安装 ODM 8.8.1.3 fix pack 后，Decision Center 是否需要额外步骤的问题：

## 答案

**是的，需要额外步骤。**

安装 fix pack 后，您需要完成以下操作来真正应用 fix pack 到您的环境：

### 必须执行的额外步骤：

1. **更新应用服务器上的 Decision Center 应用**
   - 更新 `jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear` 文件到应用服务器
   - 确保不要改变应用和模块的类加载策略（所有 ODM 模块保持 parent last）

2. **重新应用产品定制**
   - 将之前对 Java EE 模块（EARs 和 WARs）的所有定制重新应用到更新后的文件
   - 建议使用脚本记录和自动化这些定制，使过程更简单且不易出错

3. **重新打包客户端应用**
   - 使用更新后的库重新打包您的客户端应用程序

### 重要说明：

- Fix pack 安装只更新了安装目录中的 JAR 库和 EAR/WAR 应用文件
- **不需要数据迁移** - 您的项目和数据库保持不变
- 使用与之前部署时相同的设置重新部署应用

### 参考文档：

完整的步骤和注意事项请参考 IBM 官方文档：
- [When and how to apply a modification or fix pack](http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665766)

**Sources:**
- [IBM ODM Fix Pack Application Guide](docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md)
- [ODM 8.5.1.1 Fix Pack Documentation](docs/ragbench-techqa/dcaea221.md)

query: Why is the file db2jcc.jar missing after an upgrade to BPM V8.5.7 CF2016.12? After upgrading to IBM Business Process Manager V8.5.7 Cumulative Fix 2016.12, I have encountered several JDBC related exceptions during my process application development. It seems that the file db2jcc.jar was removed during the installation of the cumulative fix pack. What happened?
answer:
很抱歉，我在知识库中没有找到关于 db2jcc.jar 文件在升级到 BPM V8.5.7 CF2016.12 后丢失的具体文档。

根据检索结果，知识库中包含了许多关于 BPM V8.5.7 CF2016.12 的文档，但都没有直接提到 db2jcc.jar 文件被移除的问题。

不过，基于 IBM BPM 产品的一般情况，我可以提供一些可能的原因和建议：

## 可能的原因

1. **许可证限制** - IBM 在某些累积修复包中可能会移除第三方 JDBC 驱动程序（如 DB2 JDBC 驱动），要求用户单独下载和安装这些驱动，以符合许可证要求。

2. **版本更新策略** - 累积修复包可能不再包含某些数据库驱动程序，需要用户从数据库供应商处单独获取最新版本。

3. **安装过程问题** - 在某些情况下，delta 安装包可能会意外删除某些文件。

## 建议的解决方案

1. **手动恢复 JDBC 驱动**：
   - 从备份中恢复 db2jcc.jar 文件
   - 或从 IBM DB2 安装目录中复制该文件到 BPM 的相应位置

2. **下载最新的 DB2 JDBC 驱动**：
   - 从 IBM Fix Central 或 DB2 产品页面下载兼容的 JDBC 驱动
   - 将其放置到 BPM 的 lib 目录中

3. **联系 IBM 支持**：
   - 由于知识库中没有这个特定问题的文档，建议开启支持工单以获取官方确认和解决方案

如果您需要更详细的帮助，建议提供具体的错误日志信息，这样可以更准确地诊断问题。

33)\\\\n   at\\\\n   com.lombardisoftware.bpd.component.flowcomponent.event.worker.Ti\\\\n   merEventWorkerHelper.calculateRelativeToDueDate(TimerEventWorker\\\\n   Helper.java:410)\\\\n   at\\\\n ode.doWork(FlowObjectExecutionTreeNode.java:373)\\\\n   at\\\\n   com.lombardisoftware.bpd.runtime.engine.FlowObjectExecutionTreeN\\\\n boundary event in\\\\n   a different way. There are several options other than relative\\\\n   to due date, for example, you could define the timer boundary\\\\n   event relative to the start of the step or a custom date that is\\\\n   hardcoded or is from a process variable.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM SUMMARY\\\\n *  If a user task runs in a loop, each task instance has its own\\\\n   due date. A timer boundary event on an activity is a timer for\\\\n   the overall activity, not a timer for each instance of the loop.\\\\n   There is only one timer and that one timer cannot be calculated\\\\n   relative to multiple different due dates of several task\\\\n   instances. It is, therefore, not possible to run a process in\\\\n   such a combination.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM CONCLUSION\\\\n *  A fix will be included in IBM BPM V8.5.7 cumulative fix 2016.12\\\\n   that shows a validation error for processes that contain such a\\\\n   non-executable definition. Business Process Manager\\\\n   (BPM) database and a JavaScript object of type TWSearch that\\\\n   specifies the date value or date values as a search parameter,\\\\n   even though the value or values match existing process instances\\\\n   or tasks.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLOCAL FIX\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM SUMMARY\\\\n *  If you store time values in process variables that are marked as\\\\n   visible in IBM Process Portal, the time values include\\\\n   fractions of a second, you use Microsoft SQL Server as the IBM\\\\n   BPM database, and you run a search specifying an exact match\\\\n   filter with a time value that includes fractions of a second, an\\\\n   empty result might be returned.\\\\n\\\\n   On Microsoft SQL Server, IBM BPM stores searchable variables of\\\\n   type \\\\\\"time\\\\\\" in columns of type DATETIME. During insertion, the\\\\n   value is rounded to increments of .000, .003, or .007 seconds.\\\\n   If the search value has fractions of a second that do not\\\\n   exactly match the rounded value, the comparison fails. As a\\\\n   result, corresponding process instances or tasks cannot be\\\\n   retrieved.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM CONCLUSION\\\\n *  A fix will be available in IBM BPM V8.5.7 cumulative fix 2016.12\\\\n   that casts the search value to DATETIME before the comparison\\\\n   is done.\\\\n\\\\n   To determine whether the cumulative fix is available, complete\\\\n   the following steps on Fix Central\\\\n   (http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral):\\\\n\\\\n   1. On the Select product tab, select WebSphere as the product\\\\n   group, IBM Business Process Manager with your edition from the\\\\n   WebSphere options, All as the installed version, and All as the\\\\n   platform, and then click Continue.\\\\n   2. English\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n How can I configure the DB2 JCC properties for DB2 pureScale affinity on Tomcat ?\\\\n\\\\nANSWER\\\\nFor Java applications including stand alone or web applications in the Web Application Server (WAS), the necessary DB2 JDBC properties for DB2 pureScale affinity configuration are same.\\\\nFor the detail of the JDBC properties, refer to the link in this page below.\\\\nFollowing steps are an example configuration of the client affinity on Tomcat.\\\\n\\\\n1. Set pureScale member host names to the /etc/hosts of the operating system where Tomcat will be running.\\\\nAs pureScale java client refers the serverlist which is received from pureScale server,\\\\nit\'s necessary to set the hosts and the pureScale member IP to the /etc/hosts file.\\\\n\\\\n$ cat /etc/hosts\\\\n.....\\\\n\\\\n192.168.153.65 db2ps1.au.ibm.com db2ps1\\\\n\\\\n192.168.153.64 db2ps2.au.ibm.com db2ps2 # pureScale member 0\\\\n192.168.153.68 db2ps3.au.ibm.com db2ps3 # pureScale member 1\\\\n\\\\n2. Add JNDI resource information to the web application environment file <TOMCAT_HOME>/conf/web.xml.\\\\n\\\\n........\\\\n\\\\n<resource-ref>\\\\n<res-ref-name>jdbc/sample</res-ref-name>\\\\n<res-type>javax.sql.DataSource</res-type>\\\\n<res-auth>Container</res-auth>\\\\n</resource-ref>\\\\n\\\\n</web-app>\\\\n\\\\n3. Add JNDI data source information to tomcat configuration file <TOMCAT_HOME>/conf/context.xml\\\\n\\\\ntomcat@db2ps1:~/tomcat7054/conf> cat context.xml\\\\n<?xml version=\'1.0\' encoding=\'utf-8\'?>\\\\n<Context>\\\\n<WatchedResource>WEB-INF/web.xml</WatchedResource>\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n<Resource auth=\\\\\\"Container\\\\\\"\\\\ndriverClassName=\\\\\\"com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver\\\\\\"\\\\nname=\\\\\\"jdbc/sample\\\\\\"\\\\npassword=\\\\\\"psinst2\\\\\\"\\\\nusername=\\\\\\"psinst2\\\\\\"\\\\ntype=\\\\\\"javax.sql.DataSource\\\\\\"\\\\nurl=\\\\\\"jdbc:db2://db2ps3.au.ibm.com:61118/sample\\\\\\"\\\\nenableClientAffinitiesList=\\\\\\"1\\\\\\"\\\\nretryIntervalForClientReroute=\\\\\\"2\\\\\\"\\\\naffinityFailbackInterval=\\\\\\"300\\\\\\"\\\\nuser=\\\\\\"psinst2\\\\\\"\\\\nenableSeamlessFailover=\\\\\\"true\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\nclientRerouteAlternateServerName=\\\\\\"db2ps3.au.ibm.com,db2ps2.au.ibm.com\\\\\\"\\\\ndatabaseName=\\\\\\"sample\\\\\\"\\\\nmaxRetriesForClientReroute=\\\\\\"3\\\\\\"\\\\nclientRerouteAlternatePortNumber=\\\\\\"61118,61118\\\\\\"\\\\ndriverType=\\\\\\"4\\\\\\"\\\\ncurrentSchema=\\\\\\"psinst2\\\\\\"\\\\nremoveAbandoned=\\\\\\"true\\\\\\"\\\\nremoveAbandonedTimeout=\\\\\\"60\\\\\\"\\\\nlogAbandoned=\\\\\\"true\\\\\\"\\\\n/>\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n</Context>\\\\n4. Sample application code to get connection from the datasource name.\\\\n\\\\n.....\\\\nConnection conn = null;\\\\nStatement stmt = null;\\\\nResultSet rs = null;\\\\ntry {\\\\nContext c = new InitialContext();\\\\nDataSource ds =(DataSource)c.lookup(\\\\\\"java:comp/env/jdbc/sample\\\\\\");\\\\nconn = ds.getConnection();\\\\n......\\\\n5. During client affinity test, following message will be recorded in the Tomcat log file <TOMCAT_HOME>/logs/catalina.out\\\\n\\\\ncom.ibm.db2.jcc.am.ClientRerouteException:\\\\n[jcc][t4][2027][11212][3.63.123] A connection failed but has been\\\\nre-established. The host name or IP address is \\\\\\"db2ps2.au.ibm.com\\\\\\" and\\\\nthe service name or port number is 61,118. RELATED INFORMATION\\\\n JDBC properties for client affinities [http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/db2luw/v9r7/topic/com.ibm.db2.luw.apdv.java.doc/src/tpc/imjcc_c0056257.html]\\\\nApache Tomcat JNDI Datasource HOW-TO [http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/jndi-datasource-examples-howto.html]\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -3.7525,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"0d4f89d6\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"0d4f89d6-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/0d4f89d6.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"RN1.5.2; RN1.5.3 TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"RN1.5.2; RN1.5.3 TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM(ABSTRACT)\\\\n You use IBM Packaging Utility to delete a package or fix from a repository. Then, you install a package or a fix from the same repository by using IBM Installation Manager. You receive an error that files cannot be found.\\\\n\\\\nSYMPTOM\\\\nYou receive one of the following errors:\\\\n\\\\n * From the graphical user interface:\\\\n\\\\n * Failed to find all installation files.\\\\n\\\\n   Message ID: CRIMA1161E\\\\n\\\\n   Installation Manager was unable to find all artifacts from input repository. A package has an issue that cannot be resolved by Installation Manager.\\\\n\\\\n   Check the package repository for consistency. Otherwise, identify the package that has the issue by looking at the installation history. In Installation Manager, click File > Installation History. In console mode, enter S: View Installation History. Contact IBM customer support.\\\\n\\\\n   \'jar file <file name>\' not found in <repository>.\\\\n\\\\n   \'zip file <file name>\' not found in <repository>.\\\\n *\\\\n *\\\\n * From the command line or console mode:\\\\n\\\\n * CRIMA1154E ERROR: Error installing.\\\\n\\\\n   ERROR: \'jar file <file name>\' not found in <repository>.\\\\n\\\\n   ERROR: \'zip file <file name>\' not found in STATUS\\\\n * CLOSED AS PROGRAM ERROR.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nERROR DESCRIPTION\\\\n *  Process instances or tasks are not retrieved when you search by\\\\n   using Microsoft SQL Server as the IBM Business Process Manager\\\\n   (BPM) database and a JavaScript object of type TWSearch that\\\\n   specifies the date value or date values as a search parameter,\\\\n   even though the value or values match existing process instances\\\\n   or tasks.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLOCAL FIX\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM SUMMARY\\\\n *  If you store time values in process variables that are marked as\\\\n   visible in IBM Process Portal, the time values include\\\\n   fractions of a second, you use Microsoft SQL Server as the IBM\\\\n   BPM database, and you run a search specifying an exact match\\\\n   filter with a time value that includes fractions of a second, an\\\\n   empty result might be returned.\\\\n\\\\n   On Microsoft SQL Server, IBM BPM stores searchable variables of\\\\n   type \\\\\\"time\\\\\\" in columns of type DATETIME. During insertion, the\\\\n   value is rounded to increments of .000, .003, or .007 seconds.\\\\n   If the search value has fractions of a second that do not\\\\n   exactly match the rounded value, the comparison fails. As a\\\\n   result, corresponding process instances or tasks cannot be\\\\n   retrieved.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM CONCLUSION\\\\n *  A fix will be available in IBM BPM V8.5.7 cumulative fix 2016.12\\\\n   that casts the search value to DATETIME before the comparison\\\\n   is done.\\\\n\\\\n   To determine whether the cumulative fix is available, complete\\\\n   the following steps on Fix Central\\\\n   (http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral):\\\\n\\\\n   1. On the Select product tab, select WebSphere as the product\\\\n   group, IBM Business Process Manager with your edition from the\\\\n   WebSphere options, All as the installed version, and All as the\\\\n   platform, and then click Continue.\\\\n   2. In the Text field, enter \\\\\\"cumulative fix\\\\\\", and click\\\\n   Continue.\\\\n\\\\n   If cumulative fix 2016.12 is available, download and install it.\\\\n   When you download fix packages, ensure that you also download\\\\n   the readme file for each fix. Review each readme file for\\\\n   additional installation instructions and information about the\\\\n   fix.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n   PRODUCTS AFFECTED\\\\n   IBM BPM Advanced\\\\n   IBM BPM Standard\\\\n
