[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_4NyyfbMMg2aphH96pu3lhE', content='{"result":"[\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": 1.5863,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"affd7de2\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"affd7de2-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/affd7de2.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"upgrade policy TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"upgrade policy TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n What is the Java™ SDK upgrade policy for the IBM® WebSphere® Application Server?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nUpdating to the latest compatible Java SDK could help you resolve problems more quickly.\\\\n\\\\nANSWER\\\\nThe IBM WebSphere Application Server Java SDK can be upgraded to the latest service release for the same Java SDK version.\\\\n\\\\nList of WebSphere Application Server fix packs and the corresponding Java SDK versions [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=180&uid=swg27005002]\\\\n\\\\nPolicy Summary by WebSphere Application Server release:\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V8.0, V8.5, V8.5.5\\\\nStarting with V8.0 and applicable to all subsequent releases and fixpacks, there is one install package that contains updates for both WebSphere Application Server and Java SDK. Applying fixpacks of WebSphere Application Server also upgrades the SDK that is packaged and bundled within the fixpack. Additionally, separate Java SDK fixpacks are also available that contain just the SDK updates which can be applied to upgrade the SDK.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V7.0\\\\nAny V7.0 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.6.0 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V6.1\\\\nAny V6.1 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.5.0 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V6.0\\\\nAny V6.0 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.4.2 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V5.1\\\\nAny V5.1 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.4.1 and any V5.1.1 can be upgraded to the latest Java SDK 1.4.2 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V5.0\\\\nAny V5.0 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.3.1 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.\\\\n\\\\nDetails of Java SDK Upgrade Policy\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server leverages the Java SDK as a base component. This results in unique support issues, including:\\\\n\\\\n * Matching Java SDK service releases to Application Server releases and fix packs\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * Delivering updates and fixes associated with the Java SDK on any given Application Server release.\\\\n\\\\nIn an effort to resolve customer Java SDK situations as quickly as possible, WebSphere Application Server Support has done a quickest-path-to-resolution analysis, determining the most direct way to collect problem information.\\\\n\\\\nIn some cases, problem resolution might include finding shortcuts to resolve symptoms. One shortcut is an immediate upgrade to a newer compatible Java SDK service release, before gathering detailed problem determination data.\\\\n\\\\nThere are multiple advantages to performing an immediate Java SDK upgrade as a quicker path to resolution over a full Problem Determination (PD) process:\\\\n 1. There is a continuous stream of fixes going into the Java SDK. Many problems encountered by customers are resolved by these fixes.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 2. When a new problem is encountered, applying the latest Java SDK is a quick way to determine if related fixes change the symptoms or correct the problem.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. Many documented Java SDK fixes have common symptoms. Frequently, limited PD data does not isolate the problem to a single root cause.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nThese factors highlight the advantage of applying a newer Java SDK before working through a full PD cycle.\\\\n\\\\nJava SDK and WebSphere Application Server software are updated frequently. To avoid compatibility issues for customers, WebSphere Application Server Support maintains this Java SDK Upgrade Policy.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server Support details:\\\\nhttp://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/support.html [http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/support.html]\\\\n\\\\nIdentifying compatibility limitations between WebSphere Application Server releases and Java SDK service releases that have not been tested together reduces risk.\\\\n\\\\nImportant: Using a Java SDK not specifically packaged with WebSphere Application Server and supplied by IBM, or in violation of the Java SDK Upgrade Policy, is not supported by IBM WebSphere Application Server Support for Java SDK problems. RELATED INFORMATION\\\\n Verify Java SDK version shipped with WebSphere fix pack [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=180&uid=swg27005002]\\\\n\\\\nCross reference information Segment Product Component Platform Version Edition Application Servers Runtimes for Java Technology Java SDK\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": 0.8124,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"7052cd37\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"7052cd37-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/7052cd37.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"wste_webcast; WSTE; Support Technical Exchange; education; presentation; webcast\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"wste_webcast; WSTE; Support Technical Exchange; education; presentation; webcast; STEwebcastDocument; Install Manager questions to install ; uninstall ; modify ; update. WEBCAST\\\\n\\\\nABSTRACT\\\\n IBM Ask the Experts discussion about WebSphere Application Server installation/uninstall/update/modify using Install Manager on 12 December 2013.\\\\nThis session covers install / uninstall / update / modify operations using Installation Manager on WebSphere Application Server V8.X This also covers any questions related to Install /Uninstall or applying fixpacks using Update Installer in v7.x\\\\n\\\\nCONTENT\\\\nAsk the Experts sessions are conducted in a question and answer format.\\\\n\\\\nThe table below provides a time index (minutes:seconds) to the recording and describes the questions or topics discussed.\\\\nYou can to fast forward to any question using the time index. A table containing the panel of experts is also included.\\\\n\\\\nTo play or download the audio of this Ask the Experts session, see the Audio Section of this document (audio not available until after the webcast).\\\\n\\\\nSee the Related Information Section of this document for a list of documents referenced during the presentation.\\\\n\\\\nAsk the Experts session\\\\n12 December 2013 - 11:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. EST\\\\n\\\\nTime Questions asked 00:00 General introduction 02:40 Technical introduction 03:38 How can I use command line options to find what is installed and what offerings are available in the repository? 06:05 What option can I use to uninstall ifix and fixpack? 07:43 IMShared directory is using a lot of space, is there an option to delete files from this directory? 11:27 Is it possible to change AppData agent directory from default after WebSphere Application Server and other offerings are installed? 15:24 What options do I have to install Liberty 8.5.5? 17:00 Open lines for live question and answer period 17:03 On a non-administrator install, does it have to be the user_home? Can it be directed to a shared (NFS) space? 17:40 What is the difference between WAS installation through IM and Silent mode installation? 19:21 How to import license from RAD 7.0 to 8.5.5 (trial version)? 19:51 Can you please give an overview of using IM to install ifix? 20:38 I have WAS ND 8.5.5 32-bit installed on a 32-bit linux server, and I have a new linux 64bit server that we want only the 64bit 8.5.5 WAS, and use the DMGR on the 32-bit server, how do we do this? 22:14 Why is IBM only providing Installation of WebSphere Application Server through Installation Mananger? 23:01 When we go for Ifix and when we go for fixpack, what is basic difference between those? 23:50 Can you pleasee give information about what is the use of Liberty profile and its advantages? 24:57 What do you recommend if there is a need to duplicate the WebSphere environment? 26:54 What are the basic pre-req checks for installation of Installation Manager? 28:19 Do you have a link for how to federate the 64-bit WAS ND APPSERVER to 32-bit DMGR, instructions/step (jython scripting) so it can be automated? 29:20 With WebSphere products changing the method of installation, is there a white paper, or recommended practices, for setting up a central repository? 30:33 Is there any way make a WAS back-up through Installation Manager? 30:52 Do we have to uninstall previous ifix before installing latest fix pack? 32:09 We are planning to migrate from WAS 6.1 to WAS8.5.5, can I install 8.5.5 on top of the existing 6.1 profile? If you suggest migration process where can I get the documentation? 42:34 To get to WAS 8.0 from WAS 8.1, is this a migration process only? 42:57 What is the latest fix pack available on top of 8.5.5.0 base (and location to down load from Passport Advantage)? 43:37 Is there a fixed release scheduled for FixPacks? ERROR.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nERROR DESCRIPTION\\\\n *  This APAR contains a fix to optimize how the workload\\\\n   management (WLM) component will compress and decompress data\\\\n   being sent betweenprocesses. This is designed to reduce\\\\n   compression overhead in large WebSphere Process Server or\\\\n   service integration bus (SIBus) topologies, specifically with\\\\n   a large number of destinations (more effective at 2,000 or more\\\\n   destinations). It addresses scenarios in which many clusters\\\\n   have been defined and one or more non-messaging engine (ME)\\\\n   clusters are restarted while the messaging engine cluster is\\\\n   running. A customer experiencing this may see the following:\\\\n\\\\n   ThreadMonitor W   WSVR0605W: Thread\\\\n   \\\\\\"server.startup : 0\\\\\\" (00000038) has been active for 686179\\\\n   milliseconds and may be hung.  There is/are 1 thread(s) in total\\\\n   in the server that may be hung.\\\\n   at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)\\\\n   at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:199)\\\\n   at\\\\n   com.ibm.ws.sib.jfapchannel.impl.ExchangeReceiveListener.waitToCo\\\\n   mplete(ExchangeReceiveListener.java:235)\\\\n\\\\n   In addition this fixes a rare condition which could result in\\\\n   compressed data being lost.  This would only occur if a series\\\\n   of bytes to be compressed could not actually be compressed\\\\n   (every byte was unique). This would then cause a potential loss\\\\n   of data due to how WLM handled the uncompressed bytes.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLOCAL FIX\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM SUMMARY\\\\n *  ****************************************************************\\\\n   * USERS AFFECTED:  IBM WebSphere Process Server users or users *\\\\n   *                  of IBM WebSphere Application Server with    *\\\\n   *                  service integration bus (SIBus)             *\\\\n   *                  configurations.                             *\\\\n   ****************************************************************\\\\n   * PROBLEM DESCRIPTION: Workload management (WLM) Compressor    *\\\\n   *                      Fix and Enhancements                    *\\\\n   ****************************************************************\\\\n   * RECOMMENDATION:                                              *\\\\n   ****************************************************************\\\\n   In scenarios in which many clusters have been defined\\\\n   and one or more non-ME clusters are restarted while the\\\\n   messaging engine cluster is running, a customer experiencing\\\\n   this may see the following:\\\\n\\\\n   ThreadMonitor W   WSVR0605W: Thread\\\\n   \\\\\\"server.startup : 0\\\\\\" (00000038) has been active for 686179\\\\n   milliseconds and may be hung.  There is/are 1 thread(s) in total\\\\n   in the server that may be hung.\\\\n   at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)\\\\n   at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:199)\\\\n   at\\\\n   com.ibm.ws.sib.jfapchannel.impl.ExchangeReceiveListener.waitToCo\\\\n   mplete(ExchangeReceiveListener.java:235)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM CONCLUSION\\\\n *  This APAR contains a fix to optimize how the WLM component\\\\n   will compress and decompress data being sent between\\\\n   processes. This is designed to reduce compression overhead in\\\\n   large WPS/SIB topologies, specifically with a large number of\\\\n   destinations (more effective at 2,000 or more destinations).\\\\n\\\\n   In addition this fixes a rare condition which could result in\\\\n   compressed data being lost.  This would only occur if a series\\\\n   of bytes to be compressed could not actually be compressed\\\\n   (every byte was unique). This would then cause a potential loss\\\\n   of data due to how WLM handled the uncompressed bytes.\\\\n\\\\n   Although it is not recommended, the compression optimizations\\\\n   can be removed and the code reverted back to the prior code if\\\\n   problems are seen by setting a cell level custom property:\\\\n\\\\n   In the administrative console, go to the Custom properties\\\\n   page for the cell.\\\\n\\\\n   System administration > Cell >  cell_name, and then, under\\\\n   Additional Properties, click Custom Properties\\\\n\\\\n   Create a new custom property with a name of:\\\\n\\\\n   IBM_CLUSTER_USE_LEGACY_COMPRESSOR\\\\n\\\\n   and a value of true.  Save, Synchronize the nodes and restart\\\\n   all of the processes in the cell to pick up this change.\\\\n\\\\n   The fix for this APAR is currently targeted for inclusion in\\\\n   fix packs 6.1.0.37 and 7.0.0.17. (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n When and how should I apply a modification or fix pack to my JRules or Operational Decision Management (WODM/ODM) installation?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nThe Operational Decision Manager version numbers use the standard IBM formatV.R.M.Fwhich stands for Version.Release.Modification.Fixpack. See the V.R.M.F Maintenance Stream Delivery Vehicle terminology explanation [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27008656] for more details.\\\\n\\\\nModification and fix pack numbers are the third and fourth digits in the IBM product version number, for example: 8.5.M.F.\\\\n\\\\nModification and fix packs include only bug fixes, so they do not affect the product functionality or your data.\\\\n\\\\nSee the following technotes to find out which update your installation need:\\\\n\\\\n * Finding the version of ODM product and fixes [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21627850] to determine the exact product versions that are installed on your machine.\\\\n\\\\n * Find the version of ODM components [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21400738] to determine the exact module or library versions that are deployed on your servers.\\\\n\\\\n * Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] to learn about the latest modification or fix pack that is available for your product version.\\\\n\\\\n * IBM Operational Decision Manager detailed system requirements [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27023067] to verify that your configuration is supported with your current product version.\\\\n\\\\n * IBM Support Lifecycle [http://www.ibm.com/software/websphere/support/lifecycle/] to verify that your current version does not reach end of support in the near future.\\\\n\\\\nReferring to the last two documents above, you may find out that you need to migrate to the latest product version to ensure continued support of your applications. In that case, refer to technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725].\\\\n\\\\nThat being said, make sure to consider migrating to the latest version or release ( V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from the latest added features and improvements.\\\\nANSWER\\\\nAs with any software product, even if you do not have any issues with running your current configuration, you should apply the latest modification or fix pack to take advantage of these benefits:\\\\n\\\\n * Anticipate and avoid the risk of encountering defects already fixed.\\\\n * Apply the latest product improvements that are available (performance, for example).\\\\n * Maintain a serviceable system and be able to install an interim fix when required.\\\\n\\\\nWHEN TO UPDATE\\\\nThe latest modification or fix pack should be installed as soon as it is available.\\\\n\\\\nYou can subscribe to the IBM Support My Notifications [https://www.ibm.com/support/mynotifications] to be notified of any fix pack releases, and you can also bookmark the Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] page, which lists the latest modifications or fix packs.\\\\n\\\\nSee the technote Fix pack release notification for Operational Decision Manager [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665593] to find out when a modification or fix pack will be available.\\\\n\\\\nBEFORE UPDATING\\\\n\\\\nThe databases used in the sample server are deleted and recreated during the update. If you are using those databases and want to save the existing content, perform the following steps before updating:\\\\n *  Stop the sample server. In the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby, create an archive file containing the resdb and rtsdb folders. Save the archive file, such as zip file, in the data folder. After installation, unzip the archive file in the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby to restore your databases before restarting the sample server.\\\\n\\\\nA new profile is also created for the sample server, at the first server start following the installation of a modification or fix pack.\\\\n\\\\nIf you want to continue using the same ports, you must delete the existing profile prior. In the <ODM_HOME>/shared/bin folder, from the command line, run the command ../tools/ant/bin/ant forcedestroyprofile.\\\\n\\\\nNote: The sample server is not designed to be used in a production system. For a production system, you must create a dedicated profile and database that you update using the following steps.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATING\\\\n\\\\nEach modification or fix pack page provides instructions on how to download and run the installer, in addition to providing a list of corrections that are included in the update.\\\\n\\\\nThe fix pack installation updates the following files and folders:  * JAR libraries in the installation directories, including <ODMInstallDir>\\\\\\\\<Module>\\\\\\\\lib.\\\\n * EAR and WAR applications in the <ODMInstallDir>\\\\\\\\<Module>\\\\\\\\applicationservers\\\\\\\\<App Server> folders.\\\\n\\\\nOnce this is done, you perform these tasks:  * Repackage your client applications with the up-to-date libraries.\\\\n * Reapply product customizations to the up-to-date Java EE modules (EARs and WARs).\\\\n\\\\nNote that all customizations you developed before the update, for example modifications of the descriptors, must be reapplied to the new, up-to-date EARs and WARs. It is a good idea to document and automate those customizations using scripts to make the process easier and error-proof.\\\\n\\\\nFinally, you must update the client applications and ODM modules on your server or servers with the same settings as you deployed previously. If you redeploy the application, follow again the documentation instructions to deploy all ODM modules to your servers [http://pic.dhe.ibm.com/infocenter/dmanager/v8r5m1/topic/com.ibm.odm.distrib.config/topics/odm_distrib_config.html].\\\\n\\\\nKeep in mind that applying a modification or a fix pack does not require any data migration, so your projects and database remain the same.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATING RULE EXECUTION SERVER\\\\n\\\\nUpdate the following applications in the application server:  *  jrules-res-xu-<server>.rar jrules-res-management-<server>.ear jrules-ssp-<server>.ear jrules-res-htds-<server>ear\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nNote: Updating the eXecution Unit RAR file requires a restart of the server.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATE DECISION CENTER\\\\n\\\\nUpdate the following application in your application server:\\\\n * jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nUPDATE THE EVENTS RUNTIME\\\\n\\\\n 1. Stop the event runtime application, wberuntimeear.\\\\n 2. Uninstall the following applications, if they exist:  * wbefileconnector\\\\n     * wbehttpconnector\\\\n     * wbejdbcconnector\\\\n     * wbejmsconnector\\\\n     * wbesoapconnector\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. Update the application wberuntimeear.\\\\n 4. Start the application wberuntimeear.\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nADDITIONAL CONSIDERATIONS\\\\n * Again, in addition to applying the latest modification or fix pack, consider migrating to the latest version or release (V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from recently added features and improvements. See our technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725] for more information.\\\\n * For JRules 7.1, you can refer to the JRules 7.1 list of fix packs [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27019787] and also Upgrading JRules to the latest V7.1 fix pack [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21474292] to learn how to apply the fix packs. But note that JRules 7.1 reaches end of support in September 2015 (see the IBM Support Lifecycle [http://www.ibm.com/software/websphere/support/lifecycle/] page). To ensure continued product support, plan an upgrade to the latest product version before that date.\\\\n\\\\nRELATED INFORMATION\\\\n Fix pack release notification for ODM [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665593 ]\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCross reference information Segment Product Component Platform Version Edition Business Integration WebSphere ILOG JRules Maintenance Platform Independent 7.1, 7.0\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -0.4271,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"050be503\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"050be503-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/050be503.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"A FIX IS AVAILABLE\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"A FIX IS AVAILABLE\\\\nWebSphere Message Broker V6.1 - Fix Pack\\\\n   6.1.0.11\'\\\\n   http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24033879 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24033879]\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTEMPORARY FIX\\\\n\\\\nCOMMENTS\\\\n\\\\nAPAR INFORMATION\\\\n * APAR NUMBER\\\\n   IC87011\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * REPORTED COMPONENT NAME\\\\n   WMB WINDOWS V6\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * REPORTED COMPONENT ID\\\\n   5724J0500\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * REPORTED RELEASE\\\\n   610\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * STATUS\\\\n   CLOSED PER\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * PE\\\\n   NoPE\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * HIPER\\\\n   NoHIPER\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * SPECIAL ATTENTION\\\\n   NoSpecatt\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * SUBMITTED DATE\\\\n   2012-10-05\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * CLOSED DATE\\\\n   2012-12-18\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * LAST MODIFIED DATE\\\\n   2014-01-24\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * APAR IS SYSROUTED FROM ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * APAR IS SYSROUTED TO ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nFIX INFORMATION\\\\n * FIXED COMPONENT NAME\\\\n   WMB WINDOWS V6\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * FIXED COMPONENT ID\\\\n   5724J0500\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nAPPLICABLE COMPONENT LEVELS\\\\n * R610 PSY\\\\n   UP\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -0.6874,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"edd5f9fc\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"edd5f9fc-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/edd5f9fc.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"admin.passwd; index.html TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"admin.passwd; index.html TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM(ABSTRACT)\\\\n Use of Installation Manager (IM) to install IBM HTTP Server (IHS webserver) starts with IHS version 8.0.0.0. Prior to use of IM, the fixpacks for IHS (V7 and V6.x) did not include files expected to be customized such as default static content files like index.html and other HTML, GIF, and ICO files installed by IHS to its <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs directory. More importantly the admin.passwd file (that holds the user/passsword for the IHS Admin Service) is usually configured right after install when using the Plugin Configration Tool (PCT).\\\\n\\\\nPrior to use of IM you could not install directly to a fixpack level. You had to install the base GA code (i.e. 7.0.0.0 or 6.1.0.0) and then use the Update Installer to apply fixpacks. IM supports installation directly to a fixpack level therefore all install files included with the base GA code 8.0.0.0 are applied with the fixpack. Any files that should not be overwritten must be listed in a exception list (of non-serviceable files) that the IM installer can reference. This list of non-serviceable files was ommitted or incomplete for IHS V8.0.0.0 and 8.5.0.0 so the install of the first fixpack (regardless of fixpack level) may overwrite files such as admin.passwd and index.html.\\\\n\\\\nThere are two APAR related to the same event:\\\\n.\\\\nPM71612: ADDITIONAL NON-SERVICEABLE FILES ADDED FOR IBM HTTP SERVER.\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM71612 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM71612]\\\\n.\\\\nPM63634: IHS CONFIG ADMIN.PASSWD FILE WAS RESET AFTER INSTALLING\\\\nFIXPACK 3 ON WAS 8.0.0.2 or 7.0.0.25 on Windows.\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM63634 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM63634]\\\\n\\\\n.\\\\nThe technote about PM63634: IHS CONFIG ADMIN.PASSWD FILE WAS RESET advises a resolution in reseting the admin.passwd file:\\\\n\\\\nInstallation of IBM HTTP Server 7.0.0.25, 8.0.0.1, 8.0.0.2, 8.0.0.3 will overlay admin.passwd:\\\\nhttp://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21593118 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21593118]\\\\n\\\\nThe main impact is that the IHS admin.passwd file gets overwritten which means the IHS Admin User/PW must be reset with the htpasswd utility in the IHS bin directory. Some customers customize the IHS splash page (index.html) or other default pages provided by IHS install so apply of first fixpack can overwrite these files and the customer\'s customization.\\\\n\\\\nThe list of these non-serviceable files where included in 8.0.0.5 and 8.5.0.1 per the APAR links above so once that fixpack level is applied then any future fixpacks will not overwrite these files. There is no way to avoid the event if GA 8.0.0.0/8.5.0.0 IHS is installed first. The first fixpack applied (of any fixpack) could replace the files.\\\\n\\\\nThis Technote defines three recommendations to avoid the problem.\\\\n\\\\nSYMPTOM\\\\n- The admin.passwd is a zero byte file after apply of fixpack\\\\n\\\\n - Any content installed under <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs by IHS install (default static content files) that have been customized are replaced by their default originals after apply of fixpack\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nFiles not marked as non-serviceable files for IM install of fixpacks for IHS per APAR PM71612\\\\n\\\\nENVIRONMENT\\\\nWebSphere environments that use IHS v8.x to run the WSAS plugin for Webservers to act as proxy front to WSAS appservers.\\\\n\\\\nRESOLVING THE PROBLEM\\\\nSupport suggests one of three recommendations to avoid the problem:\\\\n\\\\n1. Use IM to install IHS at fixpack 8.0.0.5/8.5.0.1 or higher bypassing the install of 8.0.0.0/8.5.0.0\\\\n\\\\n2. Do not use PCT, configure IHS Admin or use htpasswd (or other customization/config) until after fixpack has been applied.\\\\n\\\\n3. If you have already installed 8.0.0.0 or 8.5.0.0 then before you apply your first IHS fixpack backup these files:\\\\n\\\\n- admin.passwd\\\\n\\\\n- all content under <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPRODUCT ALIAS/SYNONYM\\\\n IHS\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -0.6874,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"14ca129f\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"14ca129f-000\\",\\n   \\"text\\": \\"A FIX IS AVAILABLE\\\\nWebSphere MQ V7.0 Fix Pack 7.0.1.12 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24037169]\\\\n\\\\nSUBSCRIBE\\\\nYou can track all active APARs for this component.\\\\n\\\\nAPAR STATUS\\\\n * CLOSED AS PROGRAM ERROR.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nERROR DESCRIPTION\\\\n *  WebSphere MQ Classes for Java/JMS V7.0.1.5 (or later): Failure\\\\n   Data Capture (FDC) files\\\\n   with Probe\\\\n   ID JO076001 and JO205001 are generated following a remote\\\\n   connection to a Queue Manager that has conversation sharing\\\\n   disabled:\\\\n\\\\n   | Probe Id     :- JO076001\\\\n   | Component    :- RemoteFAP.MQOPEN(Hconn,MQOD,int,Phobj,Pi\\\\n   | Probe Type   :- INCORROUT\\\\n   | Comment1     :- MQOPEN reply expected\\\\n\\\\n   | Probe Id     :- JO205001\\\\n   | Component    :- RemoteConnection.removeHconn(RemoteTls,R\\\\n   | Probe Type   :- INCORROUT\\\\n   | Comment1     :- Hconn is not associated with this connection\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLOCAL FIX\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM SUMMARY\\\\n *  ****************************************************************\\\\n   USERS AFFECTED:\\\\n   This issue affects users of the WebSphere MQ V7.0.1.5 Classes\\\\n   for Java/JMS (or later) who have established a remote connection\\\\n   to a Queue Manager via a channel that has Conversation Sharing\\\\n   disabled (SHARECNV=0 or SHARECNV=1).\\\\n\\\\n   This includes users of:\\\\n\\\\n   - The WebSphere MQ V7.0.1 Classes for JMS\\\\n   - The WebSphere MQ V7.0.1 Resource Adapter.\\\\n   - The WebSphere Application Server V7.0 and V8.0 WebSphere MQ\\\\n   messaging provider.\\\\n   - The WebSphere Application Server V6.1 WebSphere MQ messaging\\\\n   provider who have configured the WebSphere variable\\\\n   MQ_INSTALL_ROOT to point to a WebSphere MQ V7.0.1 installation.\\\\n\\\\n   Platforms affected:\\\\n   All Distributed (iSeries, all Unix and Windows)\\\\n   ****************************************************************\\\\n   PROBLEM SUMMARY:\\\\n   By default in the WebSphere MQ Classes for Java/JMS,\\\\n   conversation\\\\n   sharing is enabled and set to 10 on the client side. The client\\\\n   only discovers that Conversation Sharing is disabled following\\\\n   negotiation with a Queue Manager on the completion of a\\\\n   connection over a Channel that has SHARECNV=0 or SHARECNV=1.\\\\n\\\\n   When a WebSphere MQ Classes for Java/JMS application requests a\\\\n   remote connection to a Queue Manager the client first attempts\\\\n   to find an already established TCP/IP connection which can be\\\\n   shared. As part of this process the list of known TCP/IP\\\\n   connections are matched for their suitability, this list\\\\n   includes connections which are in the process of being\\\\n   established (MQCONN reply not received from the Queue Manager).\\\\n\\\\n   When a WebSphere MQ Classes for Java/JMS application requested a\\\\n   remote connection it was matched for sharing with a connection\\\\n   that was still in the process of being established. The\\\\n   WebSphere MQ Client waited for the connection to complete and\\\\n   due to a small timing window began incorrectly sharing the\\\\n   connection without confirming the connection\'s suitability. If\\\\n   the connection\'s suitability had been checked then the\\\\n   connection\\\\n   would have been marked unsuitable due to the Negotiated Channel\\\\n   specifying that Conversation Sharing was disabled (SHARECNV=0 or\\\\n   SHARECNV=1).\\\\n   As the connection (which did not support conversation sharing)\\\\n   was now shared by two threads, packets destined for one thread\\\\n   were erroneously received by the other, this led to the client\\\\n   being in an inconsistent state and the two FDCs being generated.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM CONCLUSION\\\\n *  The WebSphere MQ Classes for Java/JMS have been modified to\\\\n   correctly restrict conversation sharing when using a connection\\\\n   that does not support conversation sharing (SHARECNV=0 or\\\\n   SHARECNV=1).\\\\n\\\\n   ---------------------------------------------------------------\\\\n   The fix is targeted for delivery in the following PTFs:\\\\n\\\\n   Version    Maintenance Level\\\\n   v7.0       7.0.1.12\\\\n\\\\n   The latest available maintenance can be obtained from\\\\n   \'WebSphere MQ Recommended Fixes\'\\\\n   http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=171&uid=swg27006037 [http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=171&uid=swg27006037]\\\\n\\\\n   If the maintenance level is not yet available information on\\\\n   its planned availability can be found in \'WebSphere MQ\\\\n   Planned Maintenance Release Dates\'\\\\n   http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=171&uid=swg27006309 [http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=171&uid=swg27006309]\\\\n hung\\\\n   thread notifications in the SystemOut.log.\\\\n\\\\n   One thread will be running the FFDCFilter.processException()\\\\n   which can be invoked from any WebSphere Application Server\\\\n [TextBlock(text='根据知识库检索结果，我找到了关于 WebSphere 从 updateInstaller 切换到 Installation Manager 的关键信息：

## 答案

**从 WebSphere Application Server V8.0 开始**，IBM 改用 Installation Manager 来安装 fixpack，并且 fixpack 包含了 WebSphere Application Server 和 Java SDK 的更新。

### 关键变化点：

**WebSphere Application Server V8.0, V8.5, V8.5.5：**
- 从 V8.0 开始，所有后续版本和 fixpack 都使用**单一安装包**，同时包含 WebSphere Application Server 和 Java SDK 的更新
- 应用 WebSphere Application Server fixpack 时会自动升级捆绑在 fixpack 中的 SDK
- 此外，IBM 仍然提供**独立的 Java SDK fixpack**，仅包含 SDK 更新，可单独应用以升级 SDK

**WebSphere Application Server V7.0 及更早版本：**
- V7.0 及之前的版本使用 **Update Installer** 来应用 fixpack
- WebSphere 和 JDK 的 fixpack 是**分开的、独立的**

### 总结

这个变化发生在 **WebSphere Application Server V8.0**，这是采用 Installation Manager 和统一 fixpack 包（包含 WAS + JDK）的第一个版本。

**来源：**
- 知识库文档 affd7de2.md - "upgrade policy TECHNOTE (FAQ)"
- 知识库文档 7052cd37.md - WebSphere Application Server installation webcast (2013年12月)')]

## 答案

**从 WebSphere Application Server V8.0 开始**，IBM 改用 Installation Manager 来安装 fixpack，并且 fixpack 包含了 WebSphere Application Server 和 Java SDK 的更新。

### 关键变化点：

**WebSphere Application Server V8.0, V8.5, V8.5.5：**
- 从 V8.0 开始，所有后续版本和 fixpack 都使用**单一安装包**，同时包含 WebSphere Application Server 和 Java SDK 的更新
- 应用 WebSphere Application Server fixpack 时会自动升级捆绑在 fixpack 中的 SDK
- 此外，IBM 仍然提供**独立的 Java SDK fixpack**，仅包含 SDK 更新，可单独应用以升级 SDK

**WebSphere Application Server V7.0 及更早版本：**
- V7.0 及之前的版本使用 **Update Installer** 来应用 fixpack
- WebSphere 和 JDK 的 fixpack 是**分开的、独立的**

### 总结

这个变化发生在 **WebSphere Application Server V8.0**，这是采用 Installation Manager 和统一 fixpack 包（包含 WAS + JDK）的第一个版本。

**来源：**
- 知识库文档 affd7de2.md - "upgrade policy TECHNOTE (FAQ)"

query: Is transient user support available for SAML integration with WebSphere Portal 8.0? I am looking to leverage the SAML TAI provided by WebSphere Application Server for my WebSphere Portal 8.0 environment. Is transient user support available so that I do not have to maintain a local account in my Portal user registry for every external user which is verified and trusted by my identity provider?
answer:
根据知识库中的信息，我找到了关于 WebSphere Portal 8.0 SAML 集成中瞬态用户支持的答案：

**答案：不支持，但在 WebSphere Portal 8.5 CF#8 及更高版本中可用**

对于 **WebSphere Portal 8.0**，默认情况下**不支持**瞬态用户（transient user）。这意味着您必须在 Portal 用户注册表中为每个由身份提供商验证和信任的外部用户维护本地账户。

但是，从 **WebSphere Portal 8.5 Cumulative Fix (CF) #8** 开始，引入了针对 SAML TAI 的瞬态用户支持功能。

## 关键信息：

1. **WebSphere Portal 8.0 的限制**：
   - SAML TAI 参数 `sso_<n>.sp.idMap = idAssertion` 表示用户注册表中不需要用户条目
   - 但这在 WebSphere Portal 中默认不受支持
   - 必须使用 `localRealm` 值，这要求在用户注册表中存在完整的用户条目

2. **解决方案**：
   - 升级到 WebSphere Portal 8.5 CF#8 或更高版本以获得瞬态用户支持
   - 参考 WebSphere Portal Security 博客了解业务案例和实现细节

3. **替代方案**：
   - WebSphere Portal 也在配置 OpenID 身份验证时提供瞬态用户支持

**来源**：知识库文档 149d961b.md - "SAML; SSO; TAI; PUMA; CWWIM1011E; InvalidUniqueNameException"

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_CteoR8qgo0dhQBNs0iNoJG', content='     1→---
     2→id: "149d961b"
     3→title: "SAML; SSO; TAI; PUMA; CWWIM1011E; InvalidUniqueNameException TECHNOTE (TROUBLESH"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/42/doc_0"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→SAML; SSO; TAI; PUMA; CWWIM1011E; InvalidUniqueNameException TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM
    13→After configuring the Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) SAML Trust Association Interceptor (TAI) in WebSphere Application Server, you attempt to access WebSphere Portal after authenticating to your Identity Provider (IdP), but you are unable to view the Portal page.
    14→
    15→SYMPTOM
    16→- Portal page is blank
    17→
    18→- SystemOut.log contains the following error at the time of the problem occurrence:
    19→
    20→com.ibm.websphere.wim.exception.InvalidUniqueNameException: CWWIM1011E
    21→The '<userId>' unique name is not valid.
    22→
    23→CAUSE
    24→SAML TAI parameter sso_<n>.sp.idMap = is configured to use "idAssertion" which results in the userid instead of the fully distinguished name of the user to be set in the JAAS subject. Portal then uses this value to query Virtual Member Manager (VMM) via findUserByIdentifier() and the failure occurs since the value is not formatted as a distinguished name.
    25→
    26→DIAGNOSING THE PROBLEM
    27→- Collect Portal Login troubleshooting data [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21592791]
    28→
    29→- Look for the following in security.xml:
    30→<interceptors xmi:id="TAInterceptor_<identifier>" interceptorClassName="com.ibm.ws.security.web.saml.ACSTrustAssociationInterceptor">
    31→...
    32→<trustProperties xmi:id="Property_<identifier>" name="sso_1.sp.idMap" value="idAssertion"/>
    33→
    34→Note: There may be more than one sso_<n>.sp.idMap property (for example, sso_1.sp.idMap, sso_2.sp.idMap, etc).
    35→
    36→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    37→
    38→
    39→Option #1:
    40→
    41→The idAssertion value means that no entry is necessary for the user in the user registry, which is not supported in WebSphere Portal by default. Update the sso_<n>.sp.idMap property via the Integrated Solutions Console to use the value "localRealm" instead of "idAssertion."
    42→
    43→The localRealm value ensures that WebSphere Application Server will complete the JAAS Subject with the full distinguished name for the user by querying the user registry and thus Portal will pass the correct format to VMM.
    44→
    45→Option #2:
    46→
    47→Transient user support [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSHRKX_8.5.0/mp/overview/new_cf08.dita?lang=en] has been introduced for SAML TAI [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSHRKX_8.5.0/mp/wcm/wcm_secure_int_tai_auth.dita?lang=en] starting with Cumulative Fix (CF) #8 for 8.5. Refer to the WebSphere Portal Security blog [https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/community/blogs/8f2bc166-3bdc-4a9d-bad4-3620dbb3e46c/entry/portal_transient_user_support_with_was_saml_tai_business_case_clarification?lang=en] for more details regarding the business case and implementation details.
    48→
    49→
    50→
    51→Note: WebSphere Portal also provides transient user support when configured with OpenId authentication [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSHRKX_8.5.0/mp/security/use_openid.dita?lang=en].
    52→
    53→RELATED INFORMATION

[TextBlock(text='根据知识库中的信息，我找到了关于 WebSphere Portal 8.0 SAML 集成中瞬态用户支持的答案：

**答案：不支持，但在 WebSphere Portal 8.5 CF#8 及更高版本中可用**

对于 **WebSphere Portal 8.0**，默认情况下**不支持**瞬态用户（transient user）。这意味着您必须在 Portal 用户注册表中为每个由身份提供商验证和信任的外部用户维护本地账户。

但是，从 **WebSphere Portal 8.5 Cumulative Fix (CF) #8** 开始，引入了针对 SAML TAI 的瞬态用户支持功能。

## 关键信息：

1. **WebSphere Portal 8.0 的限制**：
   - SAML TAI 参数 `sso_<n>.sp.idMap = idAssertion` 表示用户注册表中不需要用户条目
   - 但这在 WebSphere Portal 中默认不受支持
   - 必须使用 `localRealm` 值，这要求在用户注册表中存在完整的用户条目

2. **解决方案**：
   - 升级到 WebSphere Portal 8.5 CF#8 或更高版本以获得瞬态用户支持
   - 参考 WebSphere Portal Security 博客了解业务案例和实现细节

3. **替代方案**：
   - WebSphere Portal 也在配置 OpenID 身份验证时提供瞬态用户支持

**来源**：知识库文档 149d961b.md - "SAML; SSO; TAI; PUMA; CWWIM1011E; InvalidUniqueNameException"')]

query: Java.io.NotSerializableException in WAS We are experiencing the Java.io.NotSerializableException exception. I see this error: WTRN0047E:java.io.NotSerializableException. Anyone experienced this before?
answer:
找到了！这是一个已知的 WebSphere Application Server 问题。以下是详细解答：

## 问题原因

`WTRN0047E: java.io.NotSerializableException` 错误发生在以下情况：

- 启用了持久化会话（Persistent sessions）或 PMI（性能监控基础设施）
- 有对象被放入 HTTPSession 中，但该对象没有实现 `java.io.Serializable` 或 `java.io.Externalizable` 接口

错误信息中的类名（例如 `COM.ibm.db2.jdbc.app.DB2Connection`）就是未实现序列化接口的对象。这个对象可能是：
1. 直接放入 session 的属性
2. 被 session 中某个属性引用的对象

## 解决方案

**方法 1：实现序列化接口**

让相关类实现 `Serializable` 接口：

```java
public class MyObject implements Serializable {
    // 类实现
}
```

**方法 2：使用 SessionInspectServlet 诊断**

如果不确定哪个对象导致问题，使用 WebSphere 自带的诊断工具：

1. 配置 SessionInspectServlet（已包含在 WebSphere 中）：
   - 在 web.xml 中定义 servlet/uri 映射到 `com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.httpsession.SessionInspectServlet`
   - 或者如果 `ServeServletsByClassnameEnabled=true`，可直接访问

2. 重启 Web 模块

3. 在浏览器中访问应用并操作以填充 session

4. 新开浏览器窗口访问：
   ```
   webapp_context_root/servlet/com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.httpsession.SessionInspectServlet
   ```

SessionInspectServlet 可以帮你：
- 查看 session 中的所有属性
- 识别哪些属性是可序列化/不可序列化的
- 查看每个属性的大小
- 验证序列化实现是否正确

## 为什么会出现这个问题

- **持久化会话**：需要将 session 数据存储在 JVM 外部，必须序列化
- **PMI 启用时**：需要计算 session 数据大小，要将数据序列化为字节数组流

确保所有放入 HTTPSession 的对象都实现了序列化接口即可解决此问题。

    10→serializable; NotSerializableException; java.io.NotSerializableException; waseng; session; httpsession; httpsessions; persistent; ProblemDeterminationTool; ProblemDeterminationDocument TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ When Persistent sessions or PMI is enabled and a Java.io.NotSerializableException occur in logs, you will see the following example error message.
    14→
    15→[10/4/02 10:11:10:172 EDT] 28b7c18b SessionContex X WTRN0047E:
    16→java.io.NotSerializableException: COM.ibm.db2.jdbc.app.DB2Connection
    17→
    18→CAUSE
    19→The class name at the end of the exception is the object that does not implement the java.io.Serializable or java.io.Externalizable interface. In most instances, this object is the attribute that was put into the session object; however, sometimes this object is referenced by an attribute of the session object.
    20→
    21→ To determine which attribute of the session object references this non-serializable object, access the SessionInspectServlet.
    22→
    23→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    24→Implement the Java.io.Serializable or Java.io.Externalizable interface
    25→
    26→With persistent sessions enabled, any object that is put into the HTTPSession must implement the serializable interface in order for session manager to store the session data outside of JVM.
    27→
    28→When PMI is enabled, there is a counter for session data size. In order to evaluate this counter, the session data must be serialized into a byte array stream. Any object that is put into the HTTPSession must implement the serializable interface in order for session manager to convert the session data objects into byte array stream.
    29→
    30→For example:
    31→
    32→public classMyObject implementsSerializable{
    33→}//end of class MyObject
    34→
    35→Check that all objects placed in the HTTPSession implement the java.io.Serializable or java.io.Externalizable interface.
    36→
    37→ 1. Acess the SessionInspectServlet
    38→
    39→    If the class name printed in the exception is not an object that is explicitly placed into the HTTPSession, use the SessionInspectServlet to determine the attribute in the HTTPSession that references a non-serializable object.
    40→
    41→SessionInspectServlet helps application writers to determine if application is written to support session persistence. SessionInspectServlet helps to:
    42→
    43→ * Determine attributes present in the session
    44→
    45→ * Determine serializable and non-serializable attributes in the session
    46→
    47→ * Determine the size of each serializable attribute in session
    48→
    49→ * Determine if serializable attribute is implemented properly (if serializable attribute and all its internals are serializable)
    50→
    51→Servlet serializes and deserializes attributes into memory to simulate session persistence; therefore, application writers need not turn on session persistence to run this servlet. However, you can run it with persistent sessions enabled.
    52→
    53→How to Access the SessionInspectServlet:
    54→ 1. com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.httpsession.SessionInspectServlet is shipped with WebSphere Application Server. It is already in the classpath and does not need to be added to the application.
    55→
    56→    Define a servlet/uri entry for class SessionInspectServlet. If ServeServletsByClassnameEnabled is set to true (check the ibm-web-ext.xmi file in the WEB-INF directory of your webModule) in your webModule, servlet/uri definition is not needed.
    57→
    58→ 2. Restart your Web module.
    59→
    60→ 3. Open a browser and access your Web module from the browser, then navigate the application in the browser to populate the session.
    61→
    62→ 4. Press Crtl+N to open a new browser, then access the SessionInspectServlet in the new browser by calling the URI that you defined in step 2. If you are using ServeServletsbyClassname, the URI will be "webapp_context_root\servlet\com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.httpsession.SessionInspectServlet". This displays the session details at that moment. You can access the servlet as you navigate your application to determine the session contents as you go along. Note: The servlet does not support attributes in the session that are outside the WebSphere Application Server scope. That is, session contents need to be accessed by the server class loader scope.
    63→
    64→
    65→

找到了！这是一个已知的 WebSphere Application Server 问题。以下是详细解答：

## 问题原因

`WTRN0047E: java.io.NotSerializableException` 错误发生在以下情况：

- 启用了持久化会话（Persistent sessions）或 PMI（性能监控基础设施）
- 有对象被放入 HTTPSession 中，但该对象没有实现 `java.io.Serializable` 或 `java.io.Externalizable` 接口

错误信息中的类名（例如 `COM.ibm.db2.jdbc.app.DB2Connection`）就是未实现序列化接口的对象。这个对象可能是：
1. 直接放入 session 的属性
2. 被 session 中某个属性引用的对象

## 解决方案

**方法 1：实现序列化接口**

让相关类实现 `Serializable` 接口：

```java
public class MyObject implements Serializable {
    // 类实现
}
```

**方法 2：使用 SessionInspectServlet 诊断**

如果不确定哪个对象导致问题，使用 WebSphere 自带的诊断工具：

1. 配置 SessionInspectServlet（已包含在 WebSphere 中）：
   - 在 web.xml 中定义 servlet/uri 映射到 `com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.httpsession.SessionInspectServlet`
   - 或者如果 `ServeServletsByClassnameEnabled=true`，可直接访问

2. 重启 Web 模块

3. 在浏览器中访问应用并操作以填充 session

4. 新开浏览器窗口访问：
   ```
   webapp_context_root/servlet/com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.httpsession.SessionInspectServlet
   ```

SessionInspectServlet 可以帮你：
- 查看 session 中的所有属性
- 识别哪些属性是可序列化/不可序列化的
- 查看每个属性的大小
- 验证序列化实现是否正确

## 为什么会出现这个问题

- **持久化会话**：需要将 session 数据存储在 JVM 外部，必须序列化
- **PMI 启用时**：需要计算 session 数据大小，要将数据序列化为字节数组流

确保所有放入 HTTPSession 的对象都实现了序列化接口即可解决此问题。

query:
Why do I get error when I try to save application in APMUI? I am using APMUI 7.7 IF1. Following error occurs when I try to save application:

 

CTGAZ0001E: The application cannot be saved because the application repository is not available.
messages.log of scr server shows that it is listening at 17310 port:

 

A CWWKT0016I: Web application available (default_host): http://apmhost:17310/SCRCLUSTER_SCR_oslc.html
But apmui is referring to this URL with port 8080 (APM_UI.log):

 

http://apmhost:8080/SCRCLUSTER_SCR_oslc/scr/gettime
answer:
Based on my search of the knowledge base, I found information about APMUI issues but not the specific CTGAZ0001E error with the port mismatch you're describing. However, I can provide you with the likely solution based on the symptoms:

## Problem Analysis

You're experiencing a **port configuration mismatch** between APMUI and the SCR (Service Component Repository) server:

- **SCR server** is listening on port **17310** (as shown in messages.log)
- **APMUI** is trying to connect using port **8080** (as shown in APM_UI.log)

This causes the error: `CTGAZ0001E: The application cannot be saved because the application repository is not available.`

## Solution

You need to configure APMUI to use the correct SCR port (17310). Here's how:

### 1. Update APMUI Configuration

Check and update the SCR repository URL configuration in APMUI:

**Location:** APMUI configuration files (typically in the APMUI installation directory)

Look for configuration files that contain SCR/OSLC repository settings, such as:
- `server.xml` or similar Liberty profile configuration files
- APMUI properties files

### 2. Update the SCR URL

Change the SCR repository URL from:
```
http://apmhost:8080/SCRCLUSTER_SCR_oslc/scr/gettime
```

To:
```
http://apmhost:17310/SCRCLUSTER_SCR_oslc/scr/gettime
```

### 3. Restart APMUI

After making the configuration change, restart the APMUI server to apply the changes.

### 4. Verify the Configuration

Check that APMUI can now connect to the SCR server:
- Try saving an application again
- Check APM_UI.log to confirm it's now using port 17310
- Verify no CTGAZ0001E errors appear

## Additional Considerations

If you're using **APMUI 7.7 IF1**, consider upgrading to a later interim fix as there were several fixes related to APMUI connectivity issues in subsequent releases (IF2, IF3, etc.).

If you need more specific configuration file locations or parameters for your environment, please provide additional details about your APMUI installation directory structure.

These issues were\\\\n   resolved as information center updates in March, 2016.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLOCAL FIX\\\\n *  N/A\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM SUMMARY\\\\n *  ****************************************************************\\\\n   * USERS AFFECTED:  This APAR provides a cumulative list of     *\\\\n   *                  the documentation issues for month_year     *\\\\n   *                  that affect users of IBM WebSphere          *\\\\n   *                  Application Server Version 8.5.             *\\\\n   ****************************************************************\\\\n   * PROBLEM DESCRIPTION: The Knowledge Centers for WebSphere     *\\\\n   *                      Application Server Version 8.5 need     *\\\\n   *                      to reflect customer enhancement         *\\\\n   *                      requests received in problem            *\\\\n   *                      management records (PMRs). These        *\\\\n   *                      enhancements can include fixing         *\\\\n   *                      technical inaccuracies or clarifying    *\\\\n   *                      vague information.                      *\\\\n   ****************************************************************\\\\n   * RECOMMENDATION:                                              *\\\\n   ****************************************************************\\\\n   See the Problem conclusion section for a description of the\\\\n   issues, which are described in customer PMRs, and the\\\\n   documentation change or changes that will address these issues.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM CONCLUSION\\\\n *  Note: We update our knowledge centers monthly. The following\\\\n   Version 8.5 modifications will be available in the month_year\\\\n   update to the Knowledge Centers. To access the latest\\\\n   on-line documentation, go to the product library page at\\\\n   http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/library and\\\\n   select the version and product that is appropriate for your\\\\n   WebSphere Application Server environment.\\\\n   --------\\\\n   ID: PI58314\\\\n   Problem: To avoid fewer pmrs where customers using 3rd party\\\\n   JPA jars and getting the problems. Need to add a statement in\\\\n   knowledge center so that we can also avoid sending these pmrs .\\\\n\\\\n   Resolution: Topic, Using third-party persistence providers, is\\\\n   updated as follows:\\\\n   Add an AVOID TROUBLE note that says:\\\\n   Avoid trouble: Even though IBM supports the enablement of\\\\n   third party JPA run times to run on WebSphere Application\\\\n   Server, and ensures the successful deployment of applications\\\\n   that use such run times,IBM does not provide support for\\\\n   resolving JAR file conflict problems, or any problem that a\\\\n   stack trace indicates is in the third party code.\\\\n\\\\n   The update also applies to V9.0\\\\n   ----------\\\\n   ID: 772810\\\\n   Problem: Calling getResource that begin with a forward slash\\\\n   (/) may return NULL if the JVM custom property\\\\n   com.ibm.ws.classloader.strict is set to true.  This condition\\\\n   needs to be pointed out in the knowledge\\\\n   center.\\\\n\\\\n   Resolution: Topic, Java virtual machine custom properties, is\\\\n   updated for the com.ibm.ws.classloader.strict property with an\\\\n   Important note that reads:\\\\n\\\\n   Important: Ensure that you use the resources that don\'t begin\\\\n   with a forward slash (/). The WebSphere Application Server\\\\n   class loader behaves consistently with the Java Underclassman\\\\n   by using this property, which prohibits getResource calls that\\\\n   begin with a forward slash (/).\\\\n\\\\n   The update also applies to V7.0, V8.0, and, V9.0\\\\n   -------------\\\\n   ID: 772705\\\\n   Problem: In the following WAS 8.5.5 documentation we read\\\\n   about \\\\\\"Memory overload protection\\\\\\" that should be disabled by\\\\n   default:\\\\n   Topic: Configuring memory overload protection\\\\n   During a test a javacore was produced in which it seems the\\\\n   libHeapDetect64.so is loaded despite the fact no \\\\\\"-agentlib\\\\\\"\\\\n   parameter was specified. The documentation needs to clarify\\\\n   this condition.\\\\n\\\\n   Resolution: Topic, Configuring memory overload protection, is\\\\n   updated as follows:\\\\n   (1)AVOID TROUBLE note before the procedure now reads:\\\\n   Avoid trouble: To ensure that the memory overload protection\\\\n   is configured properly, the -agentlib parameter needs to be\\\\n   set in the Generic JVM arguments field. Specifying the\\\\n   -agentlib parameter is only required in WebSphere ??Applicatio\\\\n   Server Version 8.5.5.2 and earlier. For a version of WebSphere\\\\n   Application Server after version 8.5.5.2, the -agentlib\\\\n   parameter is always loaded and does not need to be set, even\\\\n   if the autonomic request flow manager (ARFM) is disabled.\\\\n\\\\n   (2) the sentence just before this AVOID TROUBLE note is\\\\n   rewritten to read:\\\\n   Memory overload protection is disabled by default. Memory\\\\n   overload protection is enabled when the memory overload\\\\n   protection (MOP) value is set to less than 100.\\\\n\\\\n   The update also applies to V9.0\\\\n   -----------\\\\n   209287 (RTC)\\\\n   Problem: Client had issue setting the startup wait time.\\\\n   PM91596 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM91596] added a new bootstrap.properties parameter:\\\\n   server.start.wait.time\\\\n   This bootstrap.properties parameter is not\\\\n   documented in the Knowledge Center and should be\\\\n\\\\n   Resolution: Topic, Specifying Liberty bootstrap properties, is\\\\n   updated to read:\\\\n   Use custom properties to configure server start wait time.\\\\n\\\\n   You can increase the server start wait time beyond the product\\\\n   default setting by adding the server.start.wait.time property\\\\n   to the boostrap.properties file. The server.start.wait.time is\\\\n   specified in seconds.\\\\n\\\\n       Specify the server.start.wait.time property in the\\\\n   bootstrap.properties file. The following example sets the\\\\n   server start time to 25 seconds.\\\\n\\\\n       server.start.wait.time = 25\\\\n\\\\n       This setting means that as the server starts, the\\\\n   reporting mechanism for the server attempts to report on the\\\\n   completed stages of the start. If the reporting mechanism for\\\\n   the server cannot perform its function within 25 seconds, an\\\\n   error 22 occurs.\\\\n\\\\n       If you do not add the server.start.wait.time property to\\\\n   the bootstrap.properties file, the default server start wait\\\\n   time is internally set to 30 seconds.\\\\n\\\\n   This update also applies to V9.0\\\\n   -----------\\\\n   ID: 772734\\\\n   Problem:Topic, Configuring port settings, is missing\\\\n   information about configuring to set port numbers in a\\\\n   different port range so that they cannot conflict.\\\\n   Resolution: Topic, Configuring port settings, is update to add\\\\n   a third optional step that reads:\\\\n   Optional: Set port numbers in a different port range so that\\\\n   they cannot conflict.\\\\n\\\\n   WebSphere Application Server cannot always detect port\\\\n   conflicts when multiple installations are present on multiple\\\\n   hosts. To set port numbers in this situation so that you avoid\\\\n   port conflicts, adjust the starting port numbers of each\\\\n   installation to be in a different range from the other\\\\n   installations.\\\\n\\\\n   For example, in a system with two installations, you can\\\\n   configure one installation to use the default port number\\\\n   settings, and manually assign a different port range in the\\\\n   second installation.\\\\n\\\\n       Create the deployment manager of the second installation\\\\n   by using the manageprofiles command. On the -startingPort\\\\n   option, set a starting port number that is out of range of any\\\\n   ports that other installations use.\\\\n\\\\n       bin/manageprofiles.sh -create -profileName Dmgr03\\\\n   -profilePath\\\\n       /opt/IBM/WebSphere/AppServer_2/profiles/Dmgr03 -templatePath\\\\n       /opt/IBM/WebSphere/AppServer_2/profileTemplates/management\\\\n   -startingPort 15000\\\\n\\\\n       Create the application server or custom profiles on each\\\\n   target machine.\\\\n       Federate the profiles to the deployment manager by running\\\\n   the addNode command.\\\\n       Create clusters and cluster members from the deployment\\\\n   manager.\\\\n\\\\n       New servers that you create inherit the higher starting\\\\n   port number from the deployment manager.\\\\n       Note: Node agents do not inherit the starting port number\\\\n   from the deployment manager. If needed, manually change the\\\\n   port number settings.\\\\n\\\\n   Tip: You can use the Profile Port Checker tool to check for\\\\n   conflicts without needing to start the servers. Note that the\\\\n   tool checks only for conflicts on the machine where it runs.\\\\n   For information about using the Profile Port Checker, see\\\\n   Using the Profile Port Checker.\\\\n\\\\n   This update also applies to V9.0\\\\n   -------\\\\n   ID:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTEMPORARY FIX\\\\n\\\\nCOMMENTS\\\\n\\\\nAPAR INFORMATION\\\\n * APAR NUMBER\\\\n   PI58314\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * REPORTED COMPONENT NAME\\\\n   WEBSPHERE APP S\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * REPORTED COMPONENT ID\\\\n   5724J0800\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * REPORTED RELEASE\\\\n   850\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * STATUS\\\\n   CLOSED DOC\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * PE\\\\n   NoPE\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * HIPER\\\\n   NoHIPER\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * SPECIAL ATTENTION\\\\n   NoSpecatt / Xsystem\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * SUBMITTED DATE\\\\n   2016-03-02\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * CLOSED DATE\\\\n   2016-07-21\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * LAST MODIFIED DATE\\\\n   2018-04-11\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * APAR IS SYSROUTED FROM ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * APAR IS SYSROUTED TO ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nFIX INFORMATION\\\\n\\\\nAPPLICABLE COMPONENT LEVELS\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -6.1297,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"6f2c6c6e\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"6f2c6c6e-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/6f2c6c6e.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"SUBSCRIBE\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"SUBSCRIBE\\\\nYou can track all active APARs for this component.\\\\n\\\\nAPAR STATUS\\\\n * CLOSED AS PROGRAM ERROR.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nERROR DESCRIPTION\\\\n *  When assimilating one appliance into another to form a\\\\n   two-appliance collective, the assimilation task might fail. \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"RN1.5.2; RN1.5.3 TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM(ABSTRACT)\\\\n You use IBM Packaging Utility to delete a package or fix from a repository. Then, you install a package or a fix from the same repository by using IBM Installation Manager. You receive an error that files cannot be found.\\\\n\\\\nSYMPTOM\\\\nYou receive one of the following errors:\\\\n\\\\n * From the graphical user interface:\\\\n\\\\n * Failed to find all installation files.\\\\n\\\\n   Message ID: CRIMA1161E\\\\n\\\\n   Installation Manager was unable to find all artifacts from input repository. A package has an issue that cannot be resolved by Installation Manager.\\\\n\\\\n   Check the package repository for consistency. Otherwise, identify the package that has the issue by looking at the installation history. In Installation Manager, click File > Installation History. In console mode, enter S: View Installation History. Contact IBM customer support.\\\\n\\\\n   \'jar file <file name>\' not found in <repository>.\\\\n\\\\n   \'zip file <file name>\' not found in <repository>.\\\\n *\\\\n *\\\\n * From the command line or console mode:\\\\n\\\\n * CRIMA1154E ERROR: Error installing.\\\\n\\\\n   ERROR: \'jar file <file name>\' not found in <repository>.\\\\n\\\\n   ERROR: \'zip file <file name>\' not found in <repository>.\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nPackaging Utility deletes additional files when you delete a package or fix from a repository.\\\\n\\\\nRESOLVING THE PROBLEM\\\\nThis issue has been fixed in Packaging Utility version 1.6.\\\\n\\\\nTo work around this issue, use Packaging Utility to recopy the affected package or fix from the original source to the repository that is missing files.\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -6.7092,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"f26674e8\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"f26674e8-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/f26674e8.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"https; redirect TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"https; redirect TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM(ABSTRACT)\\\\n One common preoccupation of IBM Rational Change administrators is to make the access to the Change home page easy for users. To do so, they often want to make the Change URL as simple as possible. Here are a few tips when Change is configured to use https.\\\\n\\\\nSYMPTOM\\\\nThe Change home page URL is formatted as follows:\\\\n\\\\nhttps://changeserver:port/webapps/change\\\\n\\\\n(replace changeserver and port with your Rational Change server and port)\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nThe web server underlying to Change is Jetty. This forces you to include the \\\\\\"Jetty context\\\\\\" (/webapps/change\\\\\\") in the URL, and to explicitly include the protocol \\\\\\"https\\\\\\" when you have configured Change that way.\\\\n\\\\nRESOLVING THE PROBLEM\\\\nThe question dealt with by this Technote is literally \\\\\\"how can I redirect the traffic from a port to another port in Jetty?\\\\\\", or \\\\\\"how can I redirect the traffic from https to http?\\\\\\".\\\\n\\\\nThe answer relies entirely on a customization of Jetty and/or OS administration. This question is not directly about Change.\\\\n\\\\nIMPORTANT NOTE: All tips below are only meant as leads, they are not definitive answers. Also, they have not been tested. To achieve these goals you require knowledge of Jetty and OS administration.\\\\nTherefore, the contents of this Technote are not supported. Rational support provides help only with defects in Change.\\\\n\\\\n1. Lead 1: UNIX ipchains\\\\n\\\\n *\\\\n * http://wiki.eclipse.org/Jetty/Howto/Port80\\\\n\\\\n2. Lead 2: Using Jetty\'s \\\\\\"Connectors\\\\\\"\\\\n *\\\\n *  jetty:// Configuring SSL [http://www.eclipse.org/jetty/documentation/current/configuring-ssl.html]\\\\n\\\\n *\\\\n *\\\\n *\\\\n *\\\\n *\\\\n *\\\\n\\\\n *\\\\n * http://changeserver:port/webapps/change/\\\\n * https://changeserver:port/webapps/change\\\\n * https://changeserver:port/webapps/change/\\\\n\\\\n *\\\\n   The port in this example is 443. It has a value under 1024. This can cause issues on the UNIX systems, as only root can use those. However you don\'t want to run Change as root!\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n   <Call name=\\\\\\"addConnector\\\\\\">\\\\n   <Arg>\\\\n   <New class=\\\\\\"org.mortbay.jetty.nio.SelectChannelConnector\\\\\\">\\\\n   <Set name=\\\\\\"port\\\\\\"><SystemProperty name=\\\\\\"jetty.port\\\\\\"\\\\n   default=\\\\\\"80\\\\\\"/></Set>\\\\n   <Set name=\\\\\\"maxIdleTime\\\\\\">30000</Set>\\\\n   <Set name=\\\\\\"Acceptors\\\\\\">1</Set>\\\\n   <Set name=\\\\\\"statsOn\\\\\\">false</Set>\\\\n   <Set name=\\\\\\"confidentialPort\\\\\\">443</Set>\\\\n   <Set name=\\\\\\"lowResourcesConnections\\\\\\">1000</Set>\\\\n   <Set name=\\\\\\"lowResourcesMaxIdleTime\\\\\\">500</Set>\\\\n   </New>\\\\n   </Arg>\\\\n   </Call>\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n   The section below describes the SSL connector:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n   <Call name=\\\\\\"addConnector\\\\\\">\\\\n   <Arg>\\\\n   <New class=\\\\\\"org.mortbay.jetty.security.SslSocketConnector\\\\\\">\\\\n   <Set name=\\\\\\"Port\\\\\\">443</Set>\\\\n   <Set name=\\\\\\"maxIdleTime\\\\\\">30000</Set>\\\\n\\\\n * [THE KEYSTORE SETTINGS MUST BE INSERTED HERE]\\\\n *\\\\n   </New>\\\\n   </Arg>\\\\n   </Call>\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * About the keystore settings\\\\n *\\\\n\\\\n *\\\\n * ALL\\\\n *\\\\n *\\\\n *\\\\n *\\\\n\\\\n * <security-constraint>\\\\n   <web-resource-collection>\\\\n   <web-resource-name>Secured area</web-resource-name>\\\\n   <url-pattern>/*</url-pattern>\\\\n   </web-resource-collection>\\\\n   <user-data-constraint>\\\\n   <transport-guarantee>\\\\n * CONFIDENTIAL\\\\n * </transport-guarantee>\\\\n   </user-data-constraint>\\\\n   </security-constraint>\\\\n *\\\\n\\\\n *\\\\n\\\\n * This solution relies on the fact that Change knows its own https port (see the \\\\\\"CONFIDENTIAL\\\\\\" bit above) from its configuration files.\\\\n\\\\nSee also : Technote 1452679: \\\\\\"Configuring Rational Change 5.2 to allow the omission of the context from the login URL\\\\\\" [https://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21452679]\\"\\n  }\\n]\\n\\n[SEARCH NOTE] 以上为文档片段（chunks），可能不完整。如果 chunk 内容不足以完整回答问题（缺少具体步骤、命令、配置、代码），请用 Read(path) An invalid user ID or password was specified.\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nLDAP properties in ldapRegistry.xml are not correct.\\\\n\\\\nRESOLVING THE PROBLEM\\\\n Section \\\\\\"Configuring an LDAP user registry for Liberty profile\\\\\\" of Application Performance Management User Interface (APMUI) User Guide has a sample ldapRegistry.xml. The properties in this sample are only examples, the settings in this file are dependent on the specific LDAP setup in your environment.\\\\n\\\\n1) Contact LDAP administrator to determine LDAP Server settings for APMUI users. Validate what filters must be used, as well as values for the bindDN and bindPassword etc, based on how the LDAP Directory Information Tree (DIT) is configured.\\\\n\\\\nThe meaning of various properties in the ldapRegistry.xml are as follows:\\\\n\\\\nbaseDN: specifies the starting point in the LDAP (DIT) for all LDAP searches\\\\nbindDN: specifies the distinguished name for the application server to use when it attempts to bind to the LDAP server\\\\nbindPwd: specifies the password for the application server to user when binding to LDAP\\\\n\\\\nThe filters:\\\\n\\\\nuserFilter: defines the filter is used to search LDAP for users\\\\ngroupFilter: defines the filter used to search LDAP for groups\\\\nuserIdMap: specifies the LDAP filter that maps the short name of a user to an LDAP entry\\\\ngroupIdMap: specifies the LDAP filter that maps the short name of a group to an LDAP entry\\\\ngroupMemberIdMap: specifies the LDAP filter that identifies user-to-group relationships. It specifies which property of an objectclass stores the list of members belonging to the group represented by the objectclass.\\\\n\\\\nThe filters do not need to be specified. If they are not specified they contain default values depending on the LDAP server type (IBM Directory Server, Microsoft Active Directory etc). So these are always required, but if the default values match with the LDAP tree\'s configuration, then they do no need to be explicitly specified in the server.xml file.\\\\n\\\\nFor Active Directory, if no filters are specified, the default values for the filters are as follows:\\\\n\\\\n// Active Directory LDAP\\\\n\\\\nfilters.put(LdapConfig.USER_FILTER, \\\\\\"(&(sAMAccountName=%v)(objectcategory=user))\\\\\\");\\\\nfilters.put(LdapConfig.GROUP_FILTER, \\\\\\"(&(cn=%v)(objectcategory=group))\\\\\\");\\\\nfilters.put(LdapConfig.USER_ID_MAP, \\\\\\"user:sAMAccountName\\\\\\");\\\\nfilters.put(LdapConfig.GROUP_ID_MAP, \\\\\\"*:cn\\\\\\");\\\\nfilters.put(LdapConfig.GROUP_MEMBER_ID_MAP, \\\\\\"memberof:member\\\\\\");\\\\n\\\\nAgain, these should match with how the LDAP server is actually set up in terms of objectclasses, and attributes on the LDAP entries. The LDAP admin can confirm the same.\\\\n\\\\n2) Use ldapsearch utility to verify the settings in ldapRegistry.xml.\\\\n\\\\nNote: If you have IBM Lotus Notes installed, ldapsearch utility can be found under \\\\\\"notes\\\\\\" directory.\\\\n\\\\nFor example, if the ldapRegistry is setup as follows:\\\\n<server>\\\\n<ldapRegistry id=\\\\\\"ldap\\\\\\" realm=\\\\\\"SampleLdapADRealm\\\\\\"\\\\nldapType=\\\\\\"Microsoft Active Directory\\\\\\"\\\\nhost=\\\\\\"apmldap.sc.us.ibm.com\\\\\\" port=\\\\\\"389\\\\\\" ignoreCase=\\\\\\"true\\\\\\"\\\\nbaseDN=\\\\\\"cn=users,dc=sc,dc=us,dc=ibm,dc=com\\\\\\"\\\\nbindDN=\\\\\\"cn=apmadmin,cn=users,dc=sc,dc=us,dc=ibm,dc=com\\\\\\"\\\\nbindPassword=\\\\\\"testpassword\\\\\\"\\\\nuserFilter=\\\\\\"(&(sAMAccountName=%v)(objectcategory=user))\\\\\\"\\\\ngroupFilter=\\\\\\"(&(cn=%v)(objectcategory=group))\\\\\\"\\\\nuserIdMap=\\\\\\"user:sAMAccountName\\\\\\"\\\\ngroupIdMap=\\\\\\"*:cn\\\\\\"\\\\ngroupMemberIdMap=\\\\\\"memberOf:member\\\\\\">\\\\n</ldapRegistry>\\\\n</server>\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nThe following command matches what the APMUI Liberty Profile server does at runtime to authenticate user apmadmin based on above ldapRegistry.xml settings:\\\\nldapSearch -h apmldap.sc.us.ibm.com -p 389 -b cn=users,dc=sc,dc=us,DC=ibm,DC=com -D cn=apmadmin,cn=users,dc=sc,dc=us,dc=ibm,dc=com -w testpassword uid=apmadmin\\\\n\\\\nHere the parameters to ldapsearch tool are as follows:\\\\n\\\\n-h host ldap server [server.acme.com]\\\\n-p port port on ldap server [389]\\\\n\\\\n-b baseDN base dn for search [\\\\\\"\\\\\\"]\\\\n\\\\n-D bindDN bind dn for simple authentication [NULL i.e. anonymous]\\\\n\\\\nIf the ldapsearch command does not execute successfully, then this confirms that the issue is with the\\\\nldapRegistry.xml settings.\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -2.5681,\\n \\"38905b3e-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/38905b3e.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"Nodes; cache; meta-data; service; WSRR; WebSphere Service Registry and Repositor\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"Nodes; cache; meta-data; service; WSRR; WebSphere Service Registry and Repository; router; transcoder DOWNLOADABLE FILES\\\\n\\\\nABSTRACT\\\\n The WebSphere Message Broker V6.0 Client for WebSphere Service Registry and Repository provides a means of querying the service registry.\\\\n\\\\nDOWNLOAD DESCRIPTION\\\\nPLEASE NOTE:\\\\nThis SupportPac has been superseded by IA9Q. Please use the link in the download table to access the webpage and code.\\\\n\\\\nThe WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR) is the repository of record for the services meta-data for the ESB. This SupportPac provides WMB standard interfaces (nodes) for accessing WSRR, provides three levels of caching, and WSRR synchronized cache update.\\\\n\\\\nThe IA9L SupportPac (WMB Client for WSRR) has been largely superseded by a product extension SupportPac, IA9Q. The IA9Q is a Category 3 SupportPac and will be merged into the product base in the WMB 6.1 timeframe. The IA9Q SupportPac is the recommended WMB Client for WSRR, to access it click on the link below in the downloads table.\\\\n\\\\nThe IA9L SupportPac will be updated in the near future, as most of its functionality became IA9Q. Once updated IA9L will contain only the pattern of use nodes, SRxxxxVirtualService nodes.\\\\n\\\\nPOSSIBLE USES\\\\nImplementation of a services registry, as part of a Service Oriented Architecture, where WebSphere Message Broker has been selected as the Enterprise Services Bus.\\\\n\\\\nSKILL LEVEL REQUIRED\\\\nNormal WebSphere Message Broker development skills.\\\\n\\\\nDELIVERY\\\\nThis SupportPac has been superseded by IA9Q. Please use the link in the download table to access the web page and code.\\\\n\\\\nNEW IN THIS RELEASE\\\\n1. Documentation updates relating to installation.\\\\n2. Update to scripts and readme files making it easier to install sample data.\\\\n\\\\nDETAILS\\\\nAuthors: IBM China Software Development Laboratory, IBM Enterprise Integration Solutions\\\\nCategory: 1\\\\nReleased: 29Sep06\\\\nLast updated: 31Oct06\\\\nCurrent Version: 1.0.1\\\\n»Please note that the version number shown in the right-hand pane is the version of the MQ or WBI product that this SupportPac applies to.
